description:
I've lived in the mission for years and had never tried this place till recently. I ordered a plate with 2 pupusas and a side of rice and beans and it was DELICIOUS. 

Our waiter however did have an attitude that I wasn't pleased with. Not sure if it's the same guy some people have mentioned in the reviews but I assume it is. Try being nicer you prick- he is the reason I am only giving 4 stars
author: D M.

description:
I was in Bernal Heights doing some errands and found Los Panchos walking down the street. This place is nothing fancy, but has a very homey vibe which I love. 

After browsing the menu for a bit, I opted for the 2 pupusas (chicken with cheese) and the 1/2 bowl of chicken soup. My friend got the same as I did, except he got the menudo soup and the la pupusa locas!

Our food came about 20 minutes after ordering, and both pupusas were just alright. Nothing too special and extremely cheesy - a little too much for my liking. Between the two, my favorite was the simple chicken and cheese one. The chicken soup however was really good! It was very flavorful and the chicken fell right off the bone! The menudo soup was okay, it was pretty sweet for my liking. 

Overall this place was alright. I wouldn't make my way out here to eat again, but I do love how they're open late, so definitely possible I'd come back here for the drunchies.
author: Stacey Y.

description:
Well let's say don't try asking the guy "with the attitude" (one of the owners) any questions because he will treat you like crap and like your stupid and bothering him! Sorry I asked about what kind of juice that red liquid was! 
I asked to substitute pico or salsa for nasty ass sour cream and I was told no way! 
Plus: 
I watched my order walk out the door after waiting over 30 minutes for my food and they ran outside and grabbed it then gave it to me (mind you the person who they gave it to had milled through the bag) 

So did I eat the food? Hell no and for obvious reasons! 

Bottom line go somewhere else

I'll start out by saying that I am Salvadorean and grew up with pupusas. 
This is a list where the restaurant failed. 
1. The pupusas had about 1/2 an inch of masa with no filling. A well made one will have a filling that is spread out. 
2. The salsa did not have a salvadorean flavor. It was more suited for some tacos. Pupusa salsa has a distinct flavor. This salsa was more of a Mexican salsa. 
3. The curtido again didn't have that distinct salvadorean flavor. 
The place was clean and the staff were kind and friendly. 
While they failed on providing an authentic salvadorean pupusa, the food was not bland. 

There are more authentic pupusas in the city and one last thing. Pupusas are meant to be consumed with your hands and not with a fork and knife. Try it next and you'll find that the flavor will be much better.
author: Rick O.

description:
Wow!  This place was great.  The food was tasty, the service was good, and the setting was pleasant.

I had the revueltas (pupusas with pork and cheese) with rice and salad - it was quite flavorful and filling.  My husband had the chile verde plate, and enjoyed it.

The service was friendly, helpful, and prompt.

The setting is bright, festive, clean, and welcoming.

The prices are quite reasonable.

Overall, this is a great spot, and we look forward to returning!
author: Barnali D.

description:
Real authentic food 
Very good customer service 
Food is great 

Fresh menudo the best in the city by far!!!
author: Jay V.

description: Horrible food, I found a hair on my pupusa. Also both of my pupusas were all burned. First & last time we get food at this place. Stay away if you can.
author: Daniela C.

description: On a friday at 2:30 pm with only one other customer in-house, full staffing and no line at the register, it took 5-10 minutes (!) to finally be helped.  And this was after 4 staff pointedly ignored me (lazy!) before eventually one ended up getting roped into attending to my order.  A simple  pickup order was botched, then fixed by moving around the food in front of me, altering contents, rewrapping and re-presenting to me.  Horrible customer service.  Food & pricing were decent.  I live right next and wanted to give them a chance over options in the neighborhood and sf but I'll think twice before ordering pickup, recommending them to others, or going for a sit-down meal.
author: Patrick U.

description: Service was great, takes a while to get your food, but overall the lady that was helping us was super nice. She brought us water consistently and was very polite. The food was great also and very filling! Definitely will be coming here. Portions are good as well and you will definitely end up in a food coma. Definitely worth coming for their delicious food!
author: Maryanna G.

description:
This is was our first time eating here and the food had a great amazing taste ! We were immediately greeted by the staff who offered to clean a table since there was a few families having dinner there prior to our arrival. We ordered the Salvadoran horchata which was delicious and could tell how authentic it was. The size of the pupusas were generous compared to a few that I've had. The pupusas were fluffy and so much cheese (big fan ) the masa tasted fresh not to heavily salted. I ordered the zucchini pupusas , and jalapeño pupusas. Not to overpowered. I ordered my son a tamale the elote, which was nice and fresh not dry at all, it was a moist sweet and had a hint
Of salt. For the amount of people that were dinning in , the wait was very appropriate. Did not wait to long! The waiter we had was a light skinned gentleman hair combed
To the side , very friendly and accommodating. We will be back next time we are in the area!
author: Adriana C.

description:
Old School family joint in the Mission.  The constant smell of meat grilling is intoxicating.  Combine that with good fun, fun decor, and someone you wanna be with and this is the place to be for lunch or dinner!
To Go or Dine in the Carne Asada is my go to here.  
Street parking can be a little tough, so plan ahead to walk a block or two.  Totally worth it though.  Make a night of it with a walk to one of the dive bars nearby!
Thanks Los Panchos, I'll so be back!
author: Jim P.

description: The food is good at a reasonable price.   Friendly staff and clean surrounding.  All and all a very positive experience.
author: William C.

description: They have really good papusa but the worst customer service. I've been there many times and pretty much every time a guy with some bad attitude poison the place. I've asked him questions and the way he answers is so rude. Same with the other customers. Last night we call them at 8 to order and we went to pick up the food at 8:45 because that's how long it takes them to prepare a simple two person order, and guess what it wasn't ready and the guy was not responsive. There was another lady's really nice who was apologetic and she asked us to wait for order , 20 more minuets. I doubt if I go back there anymore.
author: Zeinab A.

description:
I love that this place is open late. And if you come during the late hours, there's barely anyone on the street so there's usually parking available. 

However, the one thing I dislike about this place is their lack of staff. During my past couple of visits, I noticed that there were usually two staff working - one was the cook, one was the waiter/waitress. One time I ordered to go and my pupusas were done fairly quickly (but prolly cus they weren't busy at all). But another time, maybe around midnight, we stopped by to dine-in for some pupusas. There were probably four groups of people seated when we walked in. It took forever to take our order and make our food. One waiter managing all tables.. and one cook? Overall, the staff are pretty friendly and try to do the best they can to work with all the hands they've got.

They're pupusas are decent. I normally order the chicken and cheese for $5, which comes with two. Sometimes they're a little burnt, but I do love the cheesiness. Their pupusas taste amazing with their hot sauce/salsa (not sure what it is) and their pickled veggies mmmm!

I settle for this when I can't have La Santaneca because they close at 11.

**$10 minimum for card**
author: Sydney C.

description: As a born and raised Franciscan I must say these pupusas were exceptionally!!! El Zócalo was my spot and a place I went to growing up as a kid. Los Panchos as not only replace El Zocalo but has definitely superseded it. This is my first visit here and had the cheese pupusas. They were cooked perfectly and not greasy at all. The cosido was pickled just enough. The actually physical restaurant is a common hole in the wall and decently cleaned. But that's why you come to places to like this to get the authentic homemade  taste of Latino food!
author: Karla T.

description: The food was very, very greasy. I ordered the salt and pepper wings but they were greasy and bland so I asked for some sauce. The guy bright me some super cold sweet and sour sauce that seemed to come straight from the refrigerator. Not happy with the service either.
author: Celli C.

description: This place offers such great service and amazing food! They flavor of the food here... I recommend this place to you, the reader.
author: Jason W.

description: I never get beans in my burrito or even in chili because I'm not a fan of beans. But I stumbled in here, starving, and decided to get pork & cheese pupusas (revueltas), rice, and beans. Came with the curtido (cabbage pickles) and salsa. I devoured the whole thing!! This is not usually a neighborhood I'm hanging out in, it's kind of out of the way for me -- but I'd definitely come back for Los Panchos.
author: Soo L.

description: Love to come here for Papusas. Service is always slow. Wish the bathrooms had seat covers. Other than that, I love it
author: Marlena B.

description: Decided to give them a shot. I was disappointed. Papusa's were burnt and tasted burnt. Period.
author: Mike U.

description:
The food is good. But tonight's service was awful. And it's getting more expensive every time we are there.

The wait time was long and there was no attempt in apologizing for the bad service. If they saw that it was getting busy they shjould have called for help.
author: Laura M.

description: Trash...menudo was horrible a bowl of fat meat and juice. It was disgusting. The service took an hour to bring a quesadilla... don't recommend it.
author: Cy A.

description: I found this restaurant online and I was impressed with the rating. I came in with my family on my birthday. Since we walked in the waitress was very rude. We sat down but we were not able to order anything due to she continued to be rude. I asked to speak to the manager and she would not let me talk to him/her. There was another guy who might have been in charge who refused to talk to us. We just walked out.
author: Josue R.

description: So the wife and I decided to try out this spot that we've never been to before in our lives I guess it's been here in the mission as a little hidden Gem without me knowing. I got to say the atmosphere in the ambience is all good I like it I like it that the people around there or festive and the food the food is off the hook the pupusas are not greasy their thick and their generous with the fillings. I also like that they're very speedy on clearing tables and if you need something they bring it to you right away. I myself had the steak with platanos Fritos arroz and Frijoles and 2 pupusas on the side the food is not as heavy as people may think it was Airy and fluffy. I truly recommend this restaurant to anybody who lives in the mission or outside of the neighborhood it is truly a Hidden Gem I hope now that I post this this place won't get as busy as other restaurant have.
author: Julio R.

description:
It's no wonder that most pictures on here are their pupusas because that was the only good thing we had here. Been here twice, first time was a to-go and the most recent one we ate here during Valentine's day. 
Vday was crackin' so the wait was a bit longer it seemed like. We ordered their appetizer nacho fries with steak, carnitas burrito and cheese and chicken pupusas. Nacho fries was wack. I was expecting a big plate because 1. it was $10 2. most nachos or asada fries that I've seen or had are usually huge. But no this came in a small plate, soggy fries, big slices of tomatoes (not salsa), few pieces of wack steak and avocado, some sour cream and melted cheese. Don't get it. 
Carnitas burrito was dry. Maybe they added burrito options on their menu to satisfy people who wants burrito. But if you're not gonna do it well, don't bother. Carnitas were good, everything else was wack.
Pupusas was good with everything. Order that. 
Service was good. They tried despite being busy.
author: Claire J.

description:
One of the great things is that this place opens till 2am. It is a good spot to get that late night munchies in. However, the service here is lacking. There's usually only one server that serves and often will not get their attention for at least 10-15 mins. They often forget to bring you water and chips + salsa varies, sometimes it is free and sometime they don't provide. 

The pupusas itself are affordable. 2 for $5 in which I usually get 2 chicken and 2 pork. Note that using card is a minimum $10, other wise it is cash only. Overall, decent pupusas but not WOW material.
author: Auden W.

description:
Place seems to be known for their pupusas from scanning the reviews and photos here. I ordered the Tacos de Carne Asada tonight on my visit. Pretty tasty carne asada meat, tortillas and beans could have been better though to be honest - though big portion was appreciated. Price wasn't bad at under $10 - but definitely not as good as some other places. Service was satisfactory.

Maybe I'll order some pupusas on my next visit if I go back.
author: Carlos H.

description:
Hmm. Where to start? I guess I'll start with the good. 

I like that it's open late. I like that the staff is friendly and it seems authentic. 

The food just isn't great, though. The worst though is that it gave both me and a friend upset stomachs... and then did it again when we are the leftovers. So it was definitely this place at fault. 

We got a couple burritos and a couple pupusas. The burritos were dry and kinda small...the pupusas were tastier, at least, but they still weren't anything to write home about. The chips were stale, too. 

I'm sorry guys; I wanted to like you better, but I won't be back...not worth spending a night on the toilet for mediocre food.
author: Chris S.

description: Yum. Pollo Asado with dark meat was so delicious. And service is always amazing. Love this spot for late night dinners
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
I have been eating at Los Panchos for at least ten years maybe more. We are there at least twice a week. One of their specialties is pupusas. I think they are the best in The City. 
I have two favorites, Flautas and Machaca con huevos. Cant beat the price either.
author: Marsha A.

description: Ordered the chicken enchilada plate and was not disappointed. Homemade sauce and the chicken was seasoned not blandly boiled. Rice is not typical red but great flavor.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Love the food here... the milanesa plate with French fries, rice, and beans is super delicious.  My family and I have been going to this restaurant since I was a toddler and I have to say it's the best. Great size restaurant not to big not to small, Clean bathrooms, good service from the staff, and well priced. Read this review then go try it out for your self.
author: Steph M.

description:
dont you just love it when your coworker says "im bringing in papusas for us for dinner"
i know i do!
Especially from a place i have never has papusas from! Thanks regina for the fab food! 
I looove papusas
author: Natasha I.

description:
Came here for multiple birthday celebrations. The staff is very friendly and willing to go that extra mile that makes them shine. It's very clean and cozy. Theres a jukebox. may I suggest getting a bottle of wine? You won't regret it. It's very smooth and affordable. I will be coming back here many times. 
Thank you Los Panchos
author: Dylan N.

description: This place is 1 billion times tastier than Cancun across the street, but HOLY HELL. I have never gotten such slow service from a taqueria in my life. EVER. Taste is between 4 and 5 stars. Service gets them a three.
author: Courtney M.

description: 5 stars, nothing more to say. Great food! One of my favorite places in the City for many, many years.
author: J. C.

description: If you're gay don't go here. The owner discriminates gay people. The so called owner is the rudest person ever. We had two drinks we had bought prior to going to his restaurant because we did not know we would be stopping here. The drinks were to the side and not touched when he starts saying he is the owner and no outside drinks. We had been here a week prior and people had burger king. He said nothing to them. So i reminded him and he made some excuse only kids. We had our little 6 yr old sister with us. I said we are going to order drinks and not drinking the sodas but he still was a jerk and not serviced us. You lost a couple customers and word of mouth. It isn't the cleanest place and balompie is 100x's better!
author: Evie M.

description: The owners of this place care little for their clients. I told them I couldn't eat cheese and they serve me food with cheese in it. On top of that they wouldn't take it back and charged me for it. The server apologized and said it was the owners policy. What policy, to make people pay for food they cant eat?  I will never go there again.
author: Keith R.

description: Classic Mission Location! Always tasty! Always open!! Always Good!!! When I'm in the Mission and in the mood for pupusas or a great carne asada plate, this is my default go-to spot. It gets a bit busy in this place, sometimes the wait can vary but the food is all worth it....
author: Barney E.

description: One of the few places that serve really good pupusas in the city. They have a good selection of them for 2 for $5. A bonus that they close really late so you can eat here when everything else is closed. The service is fast, and the workers are really nice.
author: Vu D.

description:
LOOOOOOVE their Pupusas here!!! 

I live in SSF... I'll drive to the Mission JUST to get their Pupusas! Soooo good, so fresh, and their pupusas are made to the rim.  The other day, I was craving and I was having people over. I ordered 14 Pupusas and a Mar y Tierra. I got to the restaurant and my order wasn't ready yet since I just placed the order not to long go. The waiter told me to take a seat. A lady came up to me and asked me if i wanted anything I told her I was fine (This shows GOOD customer service, since i was still waiting they were willing to ask if I needed anything). I actually added Nachos to my order. In a bout 5 mins my order was done and I paid as well.

-Pupusas: were gooood!!
-Mar y Tierra: (my husband ordered): said it was good but meat slightly dry. beans and rice were tasty. Portion could have been bigger for the price. 
-Nachos: They used shredded breast chicken which I usually don't like but their chicken was really good. It was moist and flavorful. The nachos I wish was more but the portions wasn't as big as a regular taqueria would be.
author: Amara R.

description:
OK I've been in a pupusa funk since Balompie closed on 18th.  I've been bouncing around to a bunch of places to try their pupusas out and today finally hit up Los Panchos.  Gotta say I love their pupusas.  Today I only sampled the loroco (my go to everywhere) and the chicharron.   Got the combo with rice and beans and it's a great deal here.

The cheese is nice and gooey and there's not too much masa so it's not too 'doughy' for my preferences.  Cooked just right and a little cheese escaped on my loroco turning crunchy (bonus!).

The curtido is also nice and not overpowering.  Service was low key but about all I needed.  Definitely some of my favorite pupusas in SF right now.  Will definitely be going back regularly!
author: Gene X.

description: I love Los Panchos!  My first introduction to pupusas was here -- oddly had never had them before in my life -- and they are so amazing-tasting.  Food is so flavorful, and the staff is so nice -- esp the lady who serves late-night, Sandra.  Unlike some other reviewers I've never had a problem with any of the servers nor the pace of the service -- although I only come in late-night, if that makes any difference.  They have a great combination -- two pupusas with rice & fresh-smashed refried beans for $8.95 or with half-bowl of one of their delicious soups for $13.95.  Actually, their chicken soup is outstanding -- tastes so homemade, the kind that cures colds!  They usually put a hunk of chicken (on bone) in the bowl with the soup but I don't like it that way so I ask for no chicken, more veggies. They have lots of other dishes, Mexican specialties, and great drinks both alcohol and soft drinks including Salvadoran specialties, particularly Ensalada de Frutas, an extraordinarily refreshing soft drink that has a ton of chopped fresh fruit in it.  Even their chips & salsa are great -- light, not greasy chips and perfect salsa with a kick.  Another great thing about Los Panchos: LATE hours!  One of the few places in town that is open after the bars close -- 2:45am Sun-Thurs and 3:30 Fri/Sat -- but give 'em some slack and don't come in 5 mins before closing!
author: Merrick W.

description: The best thing was the Sprite can. Chips hard, guacamole bad, food late and cold. Will never come back.
author: Nima S.

description:
So, here's the deal...

My order consisted of:

1.) A half pint of Sangria (4 1/2 star, only because there was no fruit, but the taste was still great)

2.) 2 pupusas and a 1/2 soup (5 star, see for yourself)

3.) Nacho fries w/steak (5 star, see 5 star reason above)

All & all, a 5 star experience.  Food looked and tasted like authentic, HOME MADE, yummy Latin goodness...  There's an awesome lady sitting down in the back basically running the place, (& doing a heck of a job I must admit), & the service was phenomenal.  Ok, too stuffed to text anything more, try this place for yourself
author: Marlon O.

description:
This part of the Mission is a bit desolate. When I found the restaurant I was overjoyed, because I was starving. The interior is quaint, and the staff are friendly, and attentive. 
The menu is a bit short, but has all the basics of a Mexican restaurant. The meal I had was decent enough, but it was a bit more liquidy for my standards, but I'll probably end up stopping by again.
author: Joel G.

description: Came here last night to get Menudo to-go for my sick hubby and was sooooooo disappointed when I got home. When I got to the restaurant I ordered the menudo and also got a carne asada taco for myself. The server asked if I wanted everything on the taco and I said yes (even nodded my head).  When I got home and opened the box with the taco there was just meat and tortilla. No onion, cilantro or salsa AT ALL. Also, my husband said menudo usually comes with rice and a bunch of side ingredients, which were completely MIA aside from two limes. I wish I would have known that so I could've checked before leaving, but this gringa doesn't like tripe very much so I've never ordered this dish, and my husband has never ordered it with me there. I don't get why we literally got half of each order. Maybe the server forgot to grab another bag that came with it? I don't know, but I have nothing positive to say about this place, unfortunately.
author: Steph L.

description:
Worst customer service. 
BAD customer service 
Lack of customer service 
Careless attitude !
Huge disappointment
I go here all the time with family members we always eat very well at this place AND TIP GOOD! The food is amazing hands down. however, we will NO LONGER ever ever BECOMING to this place again from what we experience tonight.  This time tonight I decided to bring my friends with me because I thought they should try this place out since it "was" my fav spot. 
 Long story short we (group of 4 people)had a small Chihuahua service dog with us. It was my friends dog.  The waiter didn't say nothing to us he gave us menus everything was fine then he came back and said I'm sorry but the dog can't be in here. we were fine with that. We we're going to get up and put the dog in the car. Which was right across the street we could see through the window. As we were getting up the manager walks over with an aggressive tone and was completely rude saying you have to have a dog strap on in order to have the dog in the restaurant. I said OK that's fine. Our waiter was already telling us this but the "MANAGER (owners son) came over and told us the same thing our waiter was already telling us except in a very RUDE manner.  I ordered 4 pupusas and I really did not even want to pay for the food however the waiter was nice and I had already placed the order I didn't want them to waste food. The so-called manager was so RUDE I just I didn't understand why. His father owns the restaurant it's sad how he treated me like I go there all the time and one of the waiters asked me if I would be returning and I said probably not the manager go "OK that's fine" like he didn't even try to fix the situation he was so careless it disgusted me I really really am disappointed because I like this place a lot but he definitely killed that for me I will NOT be returning ever again. The food is great but what spoils food more than a nasty attitude. The lady waiter super sweet. If the owner reaches out to us and try to explain his sons attitude careless attitude to loyal customers than maybe we may consider our service but until then he KILLED it for us.
author: Lei S.

description: The time?  New Year's Day.  The reason?  I left my phone in the Lyft car on the NYE ride home.  The story goes like this, on NYE, a friend and I were responsible and used Lyft to trek around from place to place.  The next morning, I realized I did not have my phone.  Panic mode set in but I eventually logged in to Find My iPhone and saw that it was in Oakland.  Oakland?  I don't live and I am not in Oakland.  We contacted the Lyft driver, who confirmed I had left my phone in her car.  The unfortunate part was she was leaving for SF.  So in my car I go, Danville to SF, at a safe warp speed.  I get to SF, collect my phone, give the driver a "thank you" finders fee and I was on my way back to Danville when I drove past this spot.  I thought, man, that sounds really good about now, so I stopped.  I walked in and noted the place was busy.  I sat down, and ordered a chicken, pork and zucchini pupusas.  The server looked at me like I had just ordered one of everything on the menu and was waiting on the rest of my family or something.  He also advised me that there were two pupusas per order.  I was like, nope, we are doing this, so let's go!  When the order arrived, I tossed the cabbage topping on along with the vinegar and some hot sauce.  Boy, were they good.  They were all hot, full of flavor and fresh!  I made a point to take a few bites from all of them as I knew I would not be able to finish them (back to the looking for the whole family comment).  So I conceded and packed up the leftovers, paid my bill and left.  In all, the servicer was friendly, the place seemed like a local favorite and the pupusas were delightful.  That being said, I had my phone, a full belly and leftovers for the ride back home.
author: Sheryl M.

description: It's very disappointing that this spot hasn't lived up to what it used to be.    My uncle used to own this spot and my father helped decorate it when I was a kid.   It looks as though this is one of those places that now charges for chips & salsa... what a shame because it used to be one of my favorite spots but I refuse to pay for chips & salsa!
author: Carlos Q.

description: This is true love. Service is a little slow but worth the wait. They have the best chicken soup ever. Highly recommend going with the chicken soup and a side of cheese quesadilla. It's my favorite go to.
author: Alterrique I.

description: I've been coming here since I was a kid and I never get tired of this place. I refuse to go anywhere else for Pupusas because none compare to the ones made here!
author: Briley G.

description: It's alright... the platanos Fritos are a little overcooked. The pupusas aren't as soft as I would like
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Pretty solid food but I wasn't blown away. The pupusas were scant on the filling (and quite oily) but still enjoyable. The waiter brought me menudo instead of the beef soup I ordered (miscommunication, I guess?) , and while it tasted pretty good, I'm not big on tripe and couldn't finish it. A lot of food for the money, though.

Might come back to give it another try--the burritos looked good!
author: Gautam G.

description:
Is a Mexican/salvatorian restaurant.
Good food for late night cravings. Is busy here and the food does not come out to your table fast because they make it when you order it. A mom a pop spot.
author: Ulises R.

description: I come to Los Panchos atleast 5 times a month and it has never let me down. Their #1 "Los Panchos" carne asada plate is my favorite. The waitresses and waitress are friendly and always remember their regulars. Great place to go eat with your familia.
author: Evelyn I.

description: Terrible service. Waited 40 minutes for a $9 burrito.  If you're looking for late night food there are better options in the area.
author: Evan Z.

description: Really bad. Very disappointing food for vegetarians . Got the burrito and the quesadilla and both were just weird. The burrito had only rice and plantain in it and the quesadilla had only cheese. It was just so odd. We also got the horchata which was just sugar and milk. The only consolation is that they're open late. Maybe the meats better
author: Ashmita V.

description: Authentic Mexican Vibe with amazing food.  Walked in and was welcomes with a smile and friendly service.  Sat down with chips and salsa. Salsa was perfect l, not too hot for my super taste. Known for the best Papuas.  I ordered the amazing super burrito.  It came out in 90 seconda. Very authentic and fresh. On par with the best burritos I have had.  This place his open late and a real Mission District diamond.  5 stars.
author: Gavin M.

description: These guys are ridiculous! They started charging for chips!!! So I asked for some chips , since I remember they used to bring them all the time, but as the service was lacking, I decided, they just forgot. So they brought em and put it on my bill along with a small (not even full small cup) of rice I asked for my soup - they used to bring it for free also. Forget about water, they will never ask u if u'd like one.   I'm talking about male servers, they are way too ignorant,  not sure how they still work there for so many years. I dont think I'm coming back to give them another chance. Since my last 4 visits  were not very good.
author: Anastasia B.

description: Absolutely great customer service and the food was good too. We ordered the shrimp with rice and beans, the sangria, and another shrimp dish. Both were delicious and the portion size was reasonable as well. I would gladly return.
author: Ronald S.

description: The pupusas are so good here. The revueltas and zucchini and cheese were awesome. Salsa for the chips and salsa very spicy. It took a while for us to order but the food came fast. The horchata was different than I'm used to, it had some cocoa or something. I wouldn't get that again.
author: Brice P.

description: One of the best pupusas spots in the city and the rest of the menu is really tasty as well. Their sopa de pollo with a couple pupusas is the perfect compliment to a rainy day. Very friendly owners and staff as well.
author: Matty R.

description:
If ever you're out partying in south of mission or bernal heights area, Los Panchos is the best place to grab those late night munchies. 

What definitely keeps me coming back is their delicious pupusas as I firmly believe they are the best in town! For $5 you get 2 pupusas plus you get to mix and match! It doesn't get any better than that. I always resort to their jalapeno con queso and their carnitas con queso alongside with their cabbage and salsa, you'll be screaming for more. Also don't forget to ask for their complimentary chips and salsa.

It can get a little busy past 12am as that's when all the drunkies come stumbling in. Plus you'll be waiting 20 minutes for your food; however, after you take a bit of their delicious pupusa, it will be worth the wait.
author: Denzell S.

description:
I placed an to-go order for the Pupusas with rice & beans.  I opted to get curtido (cole slaw) on the side, which was retrieved from a mysterious spot under the counter and placed in a baggie.  Once I got home I scarfed everything down without question, despite the curtido's lack of refrigeration (or at least that is what I suspected).  It was delicious.

BUT

My stomach is made of steel - traveled to SE Asia for weeks and had no problems with street food.  But what I suspect was the curtido brought me to my knees and locked in the bathroom for most of the evening (if you know what I mean).
author: Nancy R.

description: Waited almost an hour and when I asked if my food was ready it was sitting there an only part of the order was ready. I paid $25 for two plates of pupusas and a drink. Not worth the wait. They need more staff.
author: Sky P.

description: My new go-to spot for Salvadorian food! I'm not sure what the restaurant is categorized under Mexican food when is clearly Salvadorian food. They do have some Mexican dishes, but is mainly Salvadorian food. The pupusas are sooo good here! They are conveniently open after hours on the weekends (I believe they close at 3am) for those who are strolling out of the bar or club and want to make a drive up to Mission/Bernal Heights for some late night deliciousness, it is absolutely worth it!
author: Nita C.

description:
While I had high hopes, they severely under delivered both times I went.  

Unfortunately, I had to wait over 30 min each time for pupusas - even the first time when it was just me and one other group at the restaurant.  The second time I had to wait 15 minutes before being asked for my order or drink.

Unless management can turn around this poor service (perhaps hire more staff), I do not see this place being a repeat spot for many. 

If you do intend to try this place, I would order the pupusas, but you should phone ahead your order or be prepared to wait and not receive much attention.
author: Daniel T.

description:
This place is totally overrated. Read all the reviews about the pupusas so I decided to try one. Completely tasteless. I had the cheese and jalapeño one and it barely had jalapeños. Service was meh. Nothing special. The food took a little too long for 2 pupusas, one quesadillas (saddest I've ever seen) and guacamole. 

$5 for pupusas so I won't complain much but won't be returning at all.
author: Cristal G.

description: The food here is beyond disgusting and is extremely bland. I cannot understand why all the high ratings. Service is also awful.
author: Emily G.

description: For me this place serves the best pupusas in San Francisco. Really good service. I always get my pupusas from this place. Also the atole is really bomb!!!! Every time I'm craving Salvadorian food this place always comes to mind. They are always open! Perfect for after the bar or clubs! The only thing that sucks is parking is impossible.
author: Yasuko R.

description:
Oh holy, pupusas!

How to eat a pupusa:
1. Eat it with your hands! But it you can't, cut your pupusa to a small bite piece. 
2. Take some curtído (cabbage) to put atop the piece
3. Lastly, if you like spice, top it off with some spicy salsa sauce from the tortilla chips

Tina's Tips and Tantrums
- My first and not last time trying Salvadoran food. Mom and pop shop!
- Pupusa consists of a flour fry panned on each side. The size and shape of a CD and as thick as an DVD case. Only way I can relate the two.
- Pupusa con chicharron y queso! $2.25 per pupusa?! How can you beat that?
- I don't eat Mexican food, but Mexican food does not come close to Salvadoran food. 
- Crunchy yet soft at the same time filled with pulled pork and cheese. Without the curtído, it wouldn't taste the same! It gave it a great texture and vinegar taste to balance it out.
- $40 with tip for 5 people
author: Tina N.

description: The place is nicely decorated, it has a good service and nice food. I recommend the tamarindo drink. The burrito was quite good too.
author: Jaime R.

description:
Pupusas! If you ask what kind they have they will say all kinds. The menu only says cheese & mixed so this means they have cheese, chicken, pork, beans, & veggie and mixed is pork I think lol! 
The wait was long to get them even after I called in an order to pick them up :/ 
Pro's are they open insanely late 4am to be exact, crazy.
author: Tere C.

description: If i could give this place a minus 0 I would ! Today my husband and I went there for a relaxing Sunday meal , We placed our order with the waiter and asked for a couple of extra requests aside from our normal order(charred jalapeños, guac and chips etc.) We waited for a good 20 mins. Before we saw any action towards our table , mind you there were only two tables occupied other than ours . The waiter finally came by with chips and salsa. We asked about our orders and when to expect them . The waiter assured us it wouldn't be long .( Meanwhile)My hubby and i began commenting on the bad service we were experiencing., A few mins later he showed up with one of our plates, No tortillas no drinks, No appetizers, so I got up to inquire. Next thing we know we were bombarded by the table next to us who turned out to be the owner and her family who verbally attacked us and accused us of wanting to eat at their restaurant for free . The only other patrons in the restaurant shook their heads at the supposed owners and left as well as we did ! I can honestly say I have never experienced this type of disappointing behavior or treatment at a restaurant but thankfully I won't have to in the future because I have no intentions of going back there and don't recommend anyone to either. The owners should keep their personal business seperate from actual business.
author: Star L.

description: Good place to get late night meal , I love the supreme chicken burrito!! The food is awesome , the sauce you get with this is really good.
author: Nihad V.

description:
Delicious! I ordered the pupusas with chicken and cheese. It was very flavorful and I especially enjoyed the filling. The rice and beans were good but nothing special and I probably could have done without them. My friends ordered some sangria and had to dilute it with water because it was a little too sweet. 

The service exceeded my expectations. We had a group of 8 and they got to work combining tables for us as soon as we walked in. Each employee was friendly, and brought more chips, salsa, and cabbage as we kept devouring them. They handled our large group with ease although there were many other people in the restaurant as well. The atmosphere was bright and the interior was clean. Almost everything on the menu looked delicious to me and I can't wait to come back and try some other items.
author: Morgan H.

description:
Came here to order the pupusas. Had one each off of the menu and they were alright. Sloppy falling apart, greasy and bland flavored. It was night so I thought I'd try it out. I've had better pupusas in the excelsior district (the one on Persia at).

The burrito was good but more sour cream and rice than actual meat. May it was my luck that night?
author: Amir M.

description: Sangria was GREAT. Pupusas are very filling. 2 is more than enough. Service is a little slow but only because it's packed.
author: Monica M.

description:
Yum, awesome food, fresh warm chips and spicy salsa, really nice service, what more could you want? I got the Plato tipico (sp) and it came with a luscious tamale, a delicious pastel, a flavorful and NOT greasy papusa!!! and a traditional cabbage slaw for the papusa my fave) as well as a different cabbage salad on the plate that's traditionally eaten with the pasteles. My man got carne asada and it looked Pete rly cooked, juicy and tender, the rice and beans were bomb.com/perfecto_drool.inducing
Go here! Good prices, great food, geat service!
author: Emma H.

description: The service was outstanding. I ordered a jalapeño pupusa and a pork pupusa with beef soup. The beef soup was very hearty with large chunks of beef on the bone. There were a lot of vegetables in the soup as well. The pupusas came out hot and oily. When I bit into the pupusas, the first thing I tasted was the corn meal. The pupusas did not have a lot of filling in them. I'm not sure if that is how they are supposed to be like or if its how they make them here. On a side note, the salad (more like sauerkraut) was very sour.
author: James S.

description: Oh my goodness.. I can't believe how delicious their papusas are!! I am literally writing this review as I'm eating one so I'll remember the exact feeling of happiness lol. I'm not too familiar with the food but the slaw-like side for the papusas is so amazing and I feel like I can eat it as a salad. I also ordered the steak with beans and rice and it's so favorful and tender. I love that this place is open late so I can fulfill my late night papusa cravings. Thank you flor for taking care of us for my father's birthday dinner !!!!
author: Hannah P.

description:
Got guacamole, zucchini pupusa, carnitas super burrito, and sangria - not impressed by any or it bc it wasn't cheap and it was pretty mediocre.  Def don't recommend sangria for diabetics as it tastes like it packs more sugar than a coke.

I would give them 5 stars for the pupusas though - 2 pupusas for $5 pretty screaming deal
author: Joe M.

description: Manager was rude and grabbed my friends wrist when she asked if the food was ready and threatened her that he could be more aggressive. Horrible service.
author: Gabriella P.

description: The BEST pupusas ever! My go-to place to fulfill a pupusas craving. I haven't tried any of their other food, but all I can say is pupusas are a 10/10 and the workers are pretty nice too!
author: Abigail D.

description: We went for a late night bite and even at those hours the food tasted very fresh. The server seemed to be the owner but why would the owner be working so late? I assume she was the owner based on the pride expressed in describing the food options and drinks. We tried a "jugo de ensalada de fruta" which is basically fresh squeezed fruits with cut up fruit pieces: DELICIOUS. We also had the horchata that tasted amazing. All in all the place is great to come to. I recommend it for locals and visitors. I'll be back again.
author: Jorge G.

description:
The pupusas + half soup combo is perfection. Give me two of their cheese and jalapeno pupusas and some of their luscious menudo and I'm happy. Best menudo I've had in the city.

I'm pretty sensitive to salt levels and their seasoning is just right. I also snuck some of my dining partner's beef soup (full of veggies and tender bone-in chunks of beef) and his nacho fries, which were nacho toppings on top of soft fat french fries (aka drunk food of the gods).

Clean restaurant, ample seating, friendly workers, delicious food, what else do you want?
author: Angela N.

description: Food and service was good my first visit, so I decided to go back and bring my sister and kids. Second visit was a disappointing experience. I unfortunately did not get past ordering my drinks. When I initially got there, I was still waiting on my sister and nephew, so I only ordered drinks to start. When my sister finally got there, the waitress took everyone else's order, was socializing with other customers and what appeared to be visiting family. By the time she came over to take our order (which was between 15-20 minutes after my sister arrived), I was ready for the check. I definitely will not be wasting any of my time there again.
author: Andrea T.

description:
I've been going to this place for a long time, and never thought to write a review. 

I saw it was listed as a 'Mexican' restaurant and that didn't seem right. It's a Salvadorean restaurant; that's why they serve pupusas and their chicharones are so good. 

Maybe the difference doesn't matter to yelp, but I'll bet it makes a difference to the people that own the place.

Anyway, this place has great food, is open all day AND till the wee hours of the morning.

The chips and hot sauce are fresh and delicious. The 'Platillo Typico' is a great sampler for those unfamiliar with the cuisine.

Sure, you can get tacos and burritos here, but that isn't what they do best. Although the Enchiladas Suizas are fantastic. And yes, I once found a bone in the chicken enchilada, but,
guess what? Chickens have bones! They buy whole chickens, they cook them and pull them apart to make your dinner. That's where chicken meat comes from. Sometimes you miss a bone, shit happens. If that fact frightens you, stick to frozen/boneless chicken breast at Taco Bell. Generally, if I find a bone in a Chicken or Fish dish, I am happy in the knowledge that someone in the kitchen actually bothers to buy and process whole animals. Maybe they even know how to cook...
author: Statin Island V.

description: My family has been going here since before i was born, i won't give my age though :) This is probably one of my favorite places to go eat. My go to plate is the Milanesa or chicken floutas. Can't go wrong! I am secretly in love with the cook there, they have been feeding me all my life. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu Papusas, enchiladas, fried fish, carne asada. Its all good. There open late, and the owners and staff are good people. The prices have gone up, but hey its San Francisco and in the Mission!
author: Sean M.

description:
Went here on a Saturday night after a party nearby. My friend had a dog, so I went inside to get our food to go. Ordered two Carne Asada burritos, which I'd like to think is a pretty straightforward order. After waiting by the counter for 15 minutes, the waitress came up to me and told me that it will almost be ready. At this point, I now have a group of 10 friends outside waiting on our two burritos. None of them are being let in because "there's no room to sit" even though half the tables are open. 20 minutes later, the manager comes and asks me what I ordered. After telling him, my burrito magically appears 5 minutes later. He apologized, saying that it takes longer to cook chicken than carne asada, and "had it been carne asada, it would have been ready almost instantly." Turns out I ordered carne asada homeboy. 

Moral of the story - if you don't speak Spanish, expect to be deprioritized
author: Oz D.

description: I asked for no sour cream. They ruined my burrito, put sour cream all in that. Ruined my night. It was soggy and unoriginal. 4/10
author: Steven J.

description: The chicken soup is my favorite. The steak quesadilla won my novias heart. The pupusas are delicious.  We take visitors here, order to go on cold nights... personally my favorite spot for all three food items mentioned above (especially the chicken soup)!!!
author: Ashley W.

description: Los Panchos is our new spot. Came here with a party of 6, was accommodated quickly. Food is great and it's open late! Our server, Anna, did a tremendous job. We were unsure of how their homemade drinks tasted so she offered to give us samples. She was on top of everything and extremely welcoming. Will come here again and again!
author: Jun A.

description: Soooo we waited for an hour for 4 papusas........ still waiting.  Too hungry for this. Don't recommend if you don't wanna wait a day and half for your food.
author: Megan I.

description: Place was v conveniently open when the silly place across the street was closed losers. The California burrito was to die for and they even cut it in half for us. A plus service and very good salsas all around lol I love this place all my friends come here baby
author: James C.

description: the worst service ever rude and incompetent server . maybe he thought that we don't tip... but guess what!? we do.... this was my third time here and always the same thing pour and rude service. food is ok but not great  and of course not coming back................. el mesero necesita unas clases como no ser inepto y amargado y tratar bien a la gente (clientes). y así haría  $
author: Moises F.

description: horrible fucking service! i never review but they were so fucking rude. also they take too long to get your order and bring the food to you
author: Mireya P.

description: One of my dirty secrets in life is that I don't really like pupusas. They're simply not as good as lots of other things you can eat and I don't really get the hype. BUT the pupusas as Los Panchos are really really good. Like good enough that if most pupusas were this good (and I've lived in some pretty Salvadoran neighborhoods) maybe it'd change my mind. Los Panchos is a delicious outlier.
author: Misha T.

description:
3 starts because their chicken borrito had bones (((((((it was not mentioned on the menu that you may stab the roof of your mouth with a chicken bone because they stew/boil/steam their chicken meat)))),  it was bland but at least  the beans were scrumptious. 

The pupusas revueltas  were delicious and if I decided to come back it will be the only thing I order from here.

I got up to pay at the  register because it was busy and only one lady working the floor, which I had no problem doing...BUT I kind of wish I never did because I saw the lady put tortillas in the warmer THEN touched the calculator, a pen, the menu, a little notebook to write down my total, the cash register, handled my debt card and then TOOK OUT THE TORTILLAS WITH THOSE BARE HANDS.  

I might be too much on the whole clean hands thing but I was totally grossed out. who knows what kind of  microbes are crawling on those  menus!! also, the bathroom had no paper towels.
author: Senia S.

description:
Food is amazing no doubt, which is why I'll give this place 4 stars. 
BUT, food here takes sooooooooooooooooo long to get. 
As I'm typing this, I've waited almost 40 minutes for a pupusa and guacamole. 40 MINUTES. This isn't an isolated incident. Literally like this every time.
author: Brooke S.

description:
My favorite spot for pupusas in San Francisco. I've stopped looking. The pork, the chicken, the bean and cheese... All are good. Free chips and salsa. Reasonably priced and tasty sangria. 

I love it here and it's open until 4am!!!!!!
author: Mack L.

description: Sometimes is good service but today took about 10 min to take our order not even some water on the table! Plus they took more then 10 mins for taking our order I ask for guacamole they don't have because the owner doesn't want. To pay more cuz is expensive really! Is a restaurant is disappointed !
author: Magaly M.

description: 2nd best place for pupusas in the city. I have been going to this restaurant since I was a kid.
author: Brian N.

description: Love this place! The best popusas in town and inexpensive. Very attentive and friendly service. This place has been there for over 30 years. Also, it is open until 3am and weekends until 4am.
author: Jasminka K.

description:
my favorite pupusas in the city. the service is a bit slow, but that's because they're actually cooking real food for you.

every time i go here i order the special menu item that comes with a chicken soup and two pupusas. it's a super super filling supper, and you're getting some veggies in there instead of just gorging yourself on gobs of cheese.
author: Ronny K.

description: Hands down best pupusa place in SF. So cheesy and flavorful. I've had a lot of pupusas in my day and Panchos is SO GOOD. It's inexpensive, the workers are so polite and welcoming. I'll be coming back soon.
author: Sonia R.

description: I typically pop in to grab some pupusas as take-away, but everything here is delicious! When you dine in it takes a little bit of time for the food to come out, and that is how you know that it's made with love!!
author: Jennifer Z.

description: Went on a date here. The atmosphere is casual, busy, and the staff is friendly. I got the loca papusa. I think it has everything they have put inside, it was tasty. The chips and salsa had some good heat. The hortchata was a little bit too sweet for me, it had a medicinal taste. I hope to return.
author: Benjamin G.

description:
I love the pupusas here.  The beer is really good here too.
                This place is really close to alot of my favorite bars and tons of other places.
           The sangria is excellent. Hella flavorful carne asada . I love the hours here too.
author: Luke S.

description: Ordered super burrito and papusas to-go. Pretty busy place. Got home excited to eat and my entire "super" burrito had no avocado. Pretty disappointing lack of integrity.
author: Gavin L.

description:
We both had the Bistec Ranchero.  Not as good as I've had elsewhere (even in the East Bay *gasp*) but it'll do.

They're open late and service is really friendly.   You could do worse.
author: Meg W.

description: I LOVEDthis place the first time i went. Has great Chorizo & eggs. My husband gets the Enchiladas & LOVES them. The Salvadorian Horchata tastes a little bit like old dirty water. (Don't get it) Other than that, the beans & rice are delicious & the flautas are very good also. The 3rd or 4th time i had this food i ordered delivery and it was a HUGE mistake. The food was cold and horrible. Maybe they changed the chef.. Never will go back.
author: Sophia G.

description: I was very pleased,  I love their pupusas,  although it was the only one I've ever had. My friends raved about this place so I thought I'd give it a try. The dining area is somewhat spacious. The people are awfully friendly and They're quick which is another plus. Definitely going back some day.
author: Penelope H.

description: This place is so good and so cheap!!! Of course one night I came here with drunk munchies with my friends. I didn't expect the food to be all that great but it was the best pupusa I ever had !!! I even came back the next day to show my boyfriend how good it was.
author: Francine S.

description:
What I love: Papusas, sangria, beer, open late.
What I don't love: what sort of taqueria runs out of guacamole!? Such a bummer. 

BUT! This place is awesome because the papusas are super tasty, the hot sauce is more flavorful than most taquerias, the slaw is chunky and fresh, and the sangria is delish!

Extra points for great location- walking distance to El Rio, Virgil's, and Royal Cuckoo.
author: Sydney S.

description:
I love Los Panchos.

Why? Because it's open till 3 and it's near my hood.

First of all, the cole slaw is a great touch. I love anything pickled, and they give a great amount.

I've never had papusas prior to this place, so I was in for a ride. The chichiron and cheese papusas is definitely worth a try if you come here. 

There hasn't been much of a wait when you go after 12am.
author: Rachel T.

description: Open late and super friendly. I've never have a Papusa prior to having it at Los Panchos and its damn up to amazing standards. I love papusas now and will always go after $1 Beer Monday's at El Rio.
author: Justin H.

description:
This is my go to for Salvadorean food.

WHAT I GET:

2 papusas with rice and beans.  Chiccarones and Cheese.
Im not a bean person and I am in love with their refried beans.  I once told the older female server that I was in love with their beans and she told me " oh mija we put alot of care into the beans"

The chips and guac.... topped with Salvi crema.... SO BOMB

Get the horchata... its Salvi style
author: Anne-Mary P.

description: Hey hands down these PUPUSAS are the best in the city. I'm trying hard not to say names which I don't eat no longer at the other places but I just WISH This restaurant would have better CUSTOMER SERVICE man they suck. Reality Hispanic restaurants lack on service and I've only have had one specific spot in Berkeley that it's a Pupuseria that doesn't lack on service they're great. Anyways to make it short just order take out so you can save on tip!!  So I give them a 4
author: Manuel L.

description: Very good. The Sopa de Res was great, also the pupusas revueltas. Give it a shot, I don't think you'll be sorry..
author: James P.

description: I miss El Zocalo but service at Los Panchos and the FOOD is very very good. I got "Carne Azada, Arroz, & Frijoles" the MEAT . . . man! It was GREAT! I will sure come back and try the Salvadorian Carne Azada (egg on top).
author: Monserrat M.

description: Returning to SF after having moved away five years ago, I was disappointed to learn that El Zocalo is no longer, but relieved to find out that Los Panchos does late-night pupusas, Unfortunately, as Jay N notes, the pupusas here are definitely on the greasy side. Sure, 2:00 am is  not the time to be counting calories or fat grams, but still...
author: Zain K.

description:
You're gonna wait at least 20 minutes. You're also gonna love every gooey, cheesy, steaming bite. 
The gentleman that assisted me was super suave and so damn laid back even amidst the dinner rush chaos. Handled himself like a G & was still nice. I dig!
author: Syncere S.

description: Delicious pupusas. Really good caldo de pollo which hit the spot in the half order you can get with other stuff. Sweet and attentive staff. Also, I love having a place open late where I can have a good sit down meal including some veggies - since most late night places are more taqueria or junk food/bar type places.
author: Carrie S.

description: First time eating here, they're really nice people, the atmosphere was nice as well. I went here for some pupusas and they were really good. I don't know why some reviewers don't like them but to me they tasted just like how my mom used to make them when I was a kid.
author: Edward M.

description:
Picking the perfect pupusa is a perplexing predicament. Especially in a neighborhood as rich as the Mission. We should thank our lucky estrellas there are so many family-run pupuserias from which to choose as we pass by in our lowriders as wearing our bandannas around our heads like Rhoda Morgenstern. My personal favorite remains El Zocalo just up the same block. 

Now I've tried Los Ponchos simply because El Zocalo was closed for Mother's Day. What's that about? Who yo mama? Anyway, since we had a recent experience that bordered on dismal at El Patio just across the street, Jamie W. and I decided we should try this one, especially since they're the only ones that actually have a picture of a pupusa on their sign. Inside was a vision in formica and quite empty, at least at the beginning. There was a "Pirates of the Caribbean" vibe about the puppet staged in the alcove in the back (see photo), and related Mexicana paraphernalia was all over the walls. 

Jamie went all Salvadorean on me and ordered the $7.95 Platillo Tipico (Typical Platter), which consisted of a cheese pupusa, a fried yuca, a pastelito (sort of like a hot pocket), and a tamale (see photo). It was a full plate with some shredded cabbage on the side. I ordered my own $2 pupusa with queso and loroco (see photo) but went both barrels with the house special, the $7.75 Grilled Steak "Los Panchos" which came with a pile of fries and salad and hot tortillas on the side (see photo). Pretty OK stuff with the fries the actual high point. 

Service declined but not because the waiter was at fault. For some reason, people started pouring in. Jamie and I have that butterfly effect on places (tongue in cheek) - but it was honestly amazing how the place was nearly full in about twenty minutes. The poor waiter had no other staff, so he was running around like a whirling dervish. We waited quite a while for the check. I'm thinking they may want to promote the busboy pronto. 

FOOD - 3 stars...solid Salvadorean...no El Zocalo but no El Patio either 
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...I think the puppets should start moving when it gets busy so we have some entertainment we don't have to tip 
SERVICE - 3 stars...started strong but dwindled when the floodgates opened 
TOTAL - 3 stars...I'm still going to see my Zocalo mamacitas but come next Mother's Day, well...
author: Ed U.

description:
I've been working down a list of pupuserias in San Francisco and Los Panchos was the next place to try. It was lunch hours and fellow Yelper David N and I were quickly seated as the restaurant wasn't busy with only a few groups of diners scattered around here and there. The interior was decked out with checkered floors, green-colored wooden tables, and a colorful ensemble of Salvadorian and Mexican cultural artifacts that stood out from wall to wall. Upon entering, stood at the open kitchen on the left was the pupusa lady with her hands filled with masa.

Our chips were served cold and stale which didn't give us the best start. I decided to order a Pork and Cheese Pupusa ($2) to complement a bowl of Menudo ($7.75). Thankfully the pupusa didn't come out thin, oily and crispy like the ones at Gloria's, but instead the bready outer layer gave enough dough to bite into with endless gooey cheeses that overlapped with small bits of pork to deepen its flavor. They use the same diluted salsa as the one for chips, and the generous bowl of curtido was crisp, fresh but the mild vinaigrette with a clear oregano taste was decent but a little flat than expected. This clearly wasn't the best pupusa I've had but there were some bright spots to render a decent experience.

My bowl of Menudo was fully loaded with tripe with ruminants of tendon and a small piece of pig's feet. It came with oregano, red peppers, and onions on the side along with three corn tortillas. The broth was mild but there were subtle depths of flavors and I was very happy with the generous servings. The corn tortillas were moist and some of the better ones I've came across.

David seemed to enjoy the rice and beans that came with his choice of chicken and pork pupusas with cheese ($6.45). He particularly enjoyed the beans and cheese and thought the chicken and cheese pupusa was remarkably better than the pork version.

Service was large absent while our bowl of chips was not refilled. Being highly rated on Yelp, I expected more out of this dining experience. With El Zocalo just two doors down, I don't think I would be interested in returning. With the price on point to add to a set of decent dishes, 3 strong stars for the overall experience. Despite my criticisms, I still believe this is a decent neighborhood pupuseria but certainly not among the best of many in the City.
author: Daniel L.

description: Not all that great but the papusas  were good. The quesidillas sucked ass. My cousin and I were very disappointed in those.
author: Son V.

description: Long time family favorite. Camarones al mojo de ajo, 2 pupusas de queso & a large tamarindo and I'm good to go!! Will come from Oakland just to eat here. Pupusas are a must. Food & service is great.
author: Jay A.

description: Food was really good!!! Had the Combo plate with Enchilada,Taco, rice, and beans, bomb!!! Sangria may be the best I've ever had....also salsa is authentic, fire! I'm officially a regular now...
author: Rob L.

description:
My favorite latin-american food in the Mission. 
It may be a pupusaria, but I go to panchos for the carne asada con arroz. Delicious comfort food in a non-pretentious setting.
author: Jason R.

description: One of my go-to spots for comida near Bernal. Super burrito con carne asada is my favorite, to say nothing of the pupusas. Unlike some of the places near The Mission, this one isn't as crowded. Fast service and very friendly staff too!
author: Charles M.

description:
I came here to eat the other day with my family. I had the milanesa, my mom and dad had the carne asada. Everything was delicious. I still have yet to try the pupusas.

This place has been around for a long time. My family has been coming here for years. 
The service is good, the food is good and they are open late.
author: Liz H.

description: This place is amazing it has the best pupusas intown, you do have to wait for your food but it's worth the wait
author: Mari B.

description: Very Nice and good quality of food. The pupussa is just sooooooooooo.... delicious! I love the cheese in it. hot and serve with the vinegar salad. I had their classic guacamole too... really enjoyed it with chips and salsa too. Love it!
author: Unyo N.

description: Really great service. Friendly environment and the food is fantastic. I will definitely be back again. Pupusas are amazing!
author: Rmhawk123 ..

description: I have been coming here for as long as I can remember. The staff is friendly for the most part except for on of the waiters. I honk he's to owners son. I have no other complaints but he needs to work on his social skills bc he gives everyone attitude. Other than that I love the food here. Reasonable prices and really good food. The waitress here are very friendly and attentive. I love ordering the 1/2. Soup w two pupusas. And the chan is my favorite drink. If you are ever in the mission district stop by but just remember that parking is a bit inconvenient as it's such a busy intersection so just be patient!
author: Stacy G.

description: i know this is a sit down pupuseria but their burritos are my favorite in the city.   the carnitas is  always cripsy to the max. They do take their sweet time though so be ready to wait 25+ mins for your food every time. If you're taking it to go, call first and call early.
author: Gary L.

description:
Maybe it was an off night. The chips were stale. My papusas were cold as was the rice and beans and the beans were runny, mostly water. My husband's plate looked better. How can two servings of retried beans brought to the table at the same time look so different? He said his food wasn't cold but not hot either. Oh well.
Can't say much for the service either. We thought we would try is place instead of El Zolcolo up the street because they are notoriously slow.
author: Cynthia G.

description: I've been going to los panchos for years.   All of the food I've had has been excellent.  The papusas and carne asada are fantastic.  It's a go to spot when I'm staying in the city.  I've even made the drive from San Jose and Burlingame...it's that good.  Parking in the Bank of America parking lot is 7 bucks if you can't find anything on the street.
author: Jason G.

description: So we just arrived in San Francisco on a chilly 60° night I was craving chicken soup but also enchiladas and pupusas and it turns out we found a place in the mission that has all of that. We enjoyed friendly ad attentive service. She didn't laugh when Victor accidentally ordered "puputas." I had the enchiladas suisas and  Salvadoran horchata. It sure hit the spot. Vic ordered the chicken  soup and pupusas  as de pollo. Everything was delicious. Would recommend it!
author: David J.

description: Definitely good for what it is, don't get anything but the Papusas Locas, they're amazing.
author: Maxime K.

description: We come here about twice a month with the ladies after Sunday night dinner. We are all Salvadorian so we enjoy our pupusas and cola champan. My boss's sister works here so we are always treated so great and with the best attention from all the staff, we always find parking in front or a few stores down. It's usually pretty busy but fast service and attentiveness and of course being in our ambiance what's better then that to kick back with the girls on a Sunday night. - that sounded like some oldies. Haha definitely love this place.
author: Jackie M.

description: Good for late night eatery and a great place to get away from crowded taquerias. Service can be slow but well worth the wait of yummy pupusas and delicious menudo. The pupusas and 1/2 order of menudo were hearty and was good enough to share for two, but if you like to finish it youself go for it. The orchata tasted a little different kind of like a chinese food after taste haha but the tamarind juice was awesome! Complimentary chips and salsa are also yummy especially since it was hot. Plus the salsa went so well with the pupusas. =)
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
Came here around 1:30am after a night at Knockout across the street. My roommate and I ordered 2 zucchini and cheese pupusas to share. The waitress was so friendly and very attentive. Granted, we were pretty much the only table there, but still, she was nice!!

The food itself was delicious, exactly what you're looking for. Complimentary chips and salsa. Pupusas also come with slaw. It was my roommate's first time trying a pupusa and now I think she might be in love. In total the price was around $4.50. 

I would definitely recommend Los Panchos for a late night bite. Almost makes me wish I lived closer to good ol' Bernal!
author: Jasmine M.

description:
A big thank you goes out to Tatyana K who suggested we go for papusas after picking up our red superhero Yelp capes at El Rio last night.  I think I originally passed on the offer, but I'm sure glad I changed my mind for it was a very good meal shared with Yelp Elites I had just met (Angelo F, Theron L, Sus.annah B & Tatyana K) and an old Yelp friend (Teddy B).

Perched above the entry door there's a lady who watches over all who enter Los Panchos (http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/0whJlEJwfqMYiow6Hz0XnA/l).  I thought she looked pretty cool up there, and I was thrilled that she didn't move because that might've freaked me out.

Our meal started with chips and salsa, and guacamole was ordered too (http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/4vLIshFz2KD1EBA2NyJxwg/l).  The chips were freshly fried and not too greasy.  The red salsa was nice and spicy.  I liked the guacamole which was served on a thin bed of lettuce with a dollop of sour cream scooped on top.  The guacamole was mashed up smooth and had a really fresh taste.  I had a bottle of Corona while everybody else enjoyed other beer or sangria.

We all ordered papusas which probably made it easy work for the kitchen.  The papusas are listed on the menu as appetizers.  They're two bucks apiece with a minimum order of 2 papusas per plate.  Trust me; two will fill you up really good.  For those not familiar with papusas they are kind of like a thick floury flat bread that is pan fried.  The papusas at Los Panchos are filled with cheese and pork.  They were a lot larger than I anticipated (http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/QcbSxrCJBQy0xXDpVTXzyw/l & http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/B5tx6b4oaVFJ9FKJ3tDcyw/l) and were served with the traditional curtido, a pickled cabbage relish.  

The papusas were very tasty.  I liked how the flavors of the cheese and pork blended with the slightly chewy dough.  The shredded cabbage was very mild in flavor and its crunchy texture went very well with the papusa.  The service was good and friendly.  In the company of a fun group of people it sure beat going home and cooking for myself.  This was definitely a very good meal.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: This place makes awesome pupusas. I like to purchase a stack and eat them throughout the week. The salsa and coleslaw on the top makes this a complete meal.
author: Charles B.

description: The Pupusa Loca was pretty good, filling and freshly made. (I believe that's the option with everything in it) The staff is nice and the place is open late which is convenient to stumble upon after hitting the bars in that area. They refill your chips and salsa if you dine in which is always nice.
author: Briget P.

description: Best papusas and enchiladas in SF. loved every bite of good quality ingredients!
author: Dan A.

description: The service was extremely slow, and the food wasn't very warm. They also factor tips into the bill.
author: Paul T.

description: Their Infamous Pupusa Loca is Delicious. You can't go wrong with any of their pupusas. Also their Chicharon & Yuca are bomb!  Open on weekends until 4am
author: Sloe P.

description:
The pupusas revueltas (mixed) are really good here. The place is open late and seems nice and clean, the service is cordial. 
The horchata here is pretty good in my opinion, it is the darker kind that looks a bit like light chocolate milk vs. the white milky looking horchata. Good, solid cheap meal!
author: Jose U.

description: Traditional salvi. In love it's this cute little place reminds me of Grammys home cooking can u say magically delicious for sure I'll be returning
author: Chi G.

description: HORRIBLE SERVICE!! Food was okay, would've been better if they didn't butcher our order. We sat down to order food to go and had to wait 5-10 mins for someone to finally notice us and give us menus. Took our order and was in such a rush they almost skipped 2 people. Waited another 30 mins, went to go ask for the food, and they say the foods been ready they were waiting for someone to pay. Excuse me? How would we know to pay and our food was ready when nobody checked up on us and gave us a heads up??? After we paid we asked for chips because they seemed complimentary and they charged us because WE DIDNT TIP. Why would we tip for trashy service! And then they wanted to charge again for extra salsa which was TRASH and was soupy more like a watery hot sauce. If you own this place and see this, I was there earlier with around 7 people and I hope you learn to take criticism and fix your service because I'm pissed the off by how your people thought it was okay to treat us
author: Immalynn M.

description:
Little hungry? Lotta hungry? Drunk? Sober? Hungover? Capable of eating?
If you answered yes to any of these questions, please immediately make your way to Los Panchos for supreme palate pleasure and hospitality on par with grandma's house. SERIOUSLY.  

This place is amazing.  The pupusas have just the right ratio of filling to masa and every type is equally yummy from the soft, salty cheese to the perfectly seasoned pork.  Don't forget about that pickled cabbage and spicy sauce either; those are both equally necessary and delicious!  Rice and beans- perfect. Even their sangria rocks-get a pitcher, even if dining solo.
I've also tried the chile relleno, good, but a far far cry from the excellence that is their pupusa.

As if the deliciously perfect food wasn't enough, the service here is impeccable.  This is the closest you can come to being hugged without physically being hugged.  From the moment you walk in, hearing the rhythmic beat of pupusas being made to the friendly and warm table service to the sincere "gracias" as you leave, the ambience and service is superior.

A big thank you to my boyfriend for introducing me to this place, who is equally as awesome as this restaurant, but you can't try him.
author: E G.

description: I love this restaurant. I have been coming here for years. I moved to San Diego and every time I come into town I have to go Los Panchos and have some enchiladas. This time they had a pupusa loco which has everything in one pupusa. It was really good and not greasy which can happen sometimes with pupusas.
author: Toni F.

description: Great place to go! Everything is homemade, tastes amazing, and for a great price. We had cheese pupusas, steak, yuca and plantains and everything was great!
author: Vivi K.

description: cool family owned vibe in there. their pupusas are good. we had a "loca" and a loroco. we also had their sampler plate, the tamal was real and the pastel was pretty good too. salsa is spicy.
author: Matt J.

description:
Los Panchos is a nice taqueria on Mission Street.  It's a sit down restaurant with a order-in kind of feel (even though there is service).  I much prefer it over Taqueria Cancun which sits right across the street for a place to eat.  The service is a tad slower (because you are served), but it's better quality and the portions are larger.

I had their carne asada burrito and I was not let down.  There was a fair amount of meet and the balance of cheese, guac, and rice/beans was just the right amount.  This place is open late and has a ton of seating room for those with big groups.

Definitely recommend especially if you're out late in the mission and want a place to eat with your friends!
author: Robert T.

description: Bomb... homemade food. Highly recommended. Very good food and open late. The food here never disappoints. Definitely check it out...
author: G R.

description:
We were all set to hit up our usual pupuseria down the road, when a friend recommended this place. Hey, why not? 

We show up and the place is bright and clean looking. We sit down and menus are brought to us. I ordered the chicken and pork pupusas with a bowl of chicken soup. Hubs got the jalapeño ones with soup too. Ok, first, I have to tell you that the chicken soup is like my mom makes! Second, I also had the tamarindo drink, and it too, tasted like my mom's! The jalapeño pupusas were really spicy, nice with the slaw to cool the tongue. I think my favorite was the chicken, the chicharron ones were pretty strong with the salty pork taste; a little too much for me. I already know when I get sick I'm sending the hubs for some of this soup.
author: gabby m.

description: Went last night when we found cancun was closed and was pleasantly surprised. Cheap and delicious. The casamiento wasn't the best but not bad and the pupusas were nothing special but definitely cheap and delicious food and the people working there were incredibly nice.
author: isaac t.

description: Good pupusas! And the Menudo is off the hook! Great for late night dining and they also have a good Salvedorean beer..
author: Carlos F.

description:
I grew up in Texas, right on the border, so finding food to rival the quality of the food back home has proved an incredibly difficult task, so when I say that Los Panchos is my favorite Mexican/Salvadorean restaurant in the city, it's a pretty big deal.  

I love everything about this place. Los Panchos is a small, family owned restaurant with a very small, but capable staff. The day server is an incredibly sweet older woman, always interested in how you've been, and the night server is a charming middle-age man with amazing reflexes and a great sense of humor. 

Originally, my regular order was two pupusas and a side of beans/rice, which then became one pupusa and a small bowl of soup, and is now a large bowl of soup and a side of beans. I've loved everything I have had there, and especially love the fact that the soup  ingredients are only added to the broth upon order. Fresh, delicious, and good for you. 

My partner has been going there for as long as he can remember, as have his parents. He always orders the bistek, #3 or #4, depending on whether he wants beans or platanos as a side. 

I hope to be a regular here for as long as I reside in the bay area.
author: Ash S.

description: I decided to give this a try since I saw good reviews but honestly have I shldn't have belived these reveiws. First off nasty pupusas rather eat at La Santaneca which is about 4 blocks away then this garbage. Ordered 2 pupusas de queso con loroco and 2 pupusas de queso con frijoles.
