All of these pupusas had no flavor. Greasy! The cabbage was nasty also had no flavor. The chips and the salsa tasted old. May I add no one else ate the chips everyone left it. Ordered french fries for my son $5 a plate wow! Rip off. But didnt really get bothered since my son loves french fries was surprised he didnt eat them so I decided to taste it my god it tasted horrible. Like plastic! Horchata was tremendously sweet had alot of sugar (eww) $30.99 paid for mothing shouldve went to the Peruanen restuarant next door then this garbage. BTW service was awful! No one ever came and asked us if everything was ok. They took our order and then came back when food was out from there never came back. Til 20 minutes later with the bill. Wow! GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE! NOT! Trust Me Dont waste your $$$$
author: Bernid R.

description:
Wow.... what seems to be eons ago, when I was attending at State... one time, my friend G took A and I here.  I remember the green tables and the one 4-seater table in the left corner...it was packed at the time.  First time having something called 'pupusas'

Present time: My sister took me here for pupusas.  They were delicious!!   Chicken + cheese = yum. Pork + cheese = yum too!  ($2.50 each!)  Menudo = ZOMG ginormous portion, savory, omnomnom for $7.50.  Delicious tripe, tendons, although...I'm not sure I got to the hominy. lol I was pretty stuffed from the pupusas.  We also tried the pasteles, which were delicious on the inside but we were not a fan of the odd texture of its deep-friedness. lol 

Overall, it was a delicious meal for two, with leftovers for another meal! 

Service = super friendly! Gotta love it.

Prices = cheap! 

Watch out for creepy mannequin at the top of the front door....although, my sister finds it funny! :-P
author: Fannie S.

description:
Oh so good.  I love Salvadorean food.  I love Salvadorean people. and both of those  things are awesome at los panchos. 
Delicious pupusas, delicious salsa, delicious camarones...friendly people. what else is there???
just come here. you wont be sorry
author: Nilu r.

description: The best salsa hands down in SF!! Wifi, a jukebox and great food, there is no reason to ever leave. Oh, and a gumball machine.
author: Gretchen M.

description:
First off, this place is surrounded by bars so we assume hat anyone that says this place is good MUST be drunk.  We came in sober looking for pupusas since El Zocalo closed down.  We  don't usually get pupusas here. Our favorite place is a lil ways down the street on Mission/Richland (La Santaneca--AUTHENTIC Salvadorean food)

About Pupusas -- they're NOT supposed to be greasy.  They either fried your  pupusas or there is too much greasy cheese inside. Probably to mask their lack of ingredients. 

None of us ordered the same thing. It took FOREVER!!! Definitely not the place to come to if you're hungry. Not only that, but the guy wasn't very friendly. We asked about their aguas frescas and he looked at us like we were stupid for asking. He answered us all annoyed. 
 
One of us ordered chicken pupusas, another revueltas, and the only dude at our table ordered chicharron. The revueltas were super greasy and undercooked. The masa was still soft and moist. Gross. The chicken ones were also undercooked and there was no chicken in them. There was just massive amounts of cheese and little green specks. Maybe that was bell pepper? We don't know. We called the server back cuz we had gotten cheese pupusas instead of the chicken pupusas that were ordered. He was very annoyed saying those were chicken and he didn't believe us until we opened it up and showed him there was no chicken inside. He didn't take the plate back. He just left it at the table. It took FOR-E-VER to bring back 2 chicken pupusas. Upon inspection, it was the exact same thing as the last 2. The server seemed so annoyed with us we couldn't tell him anything. We just left them there. We were charged for everything. I usually leave a nice tip, but on this occasion i left none because of the shitty service and craptastic food. No complaints on the chicharron pupusas. But then again, our guy friend eats anything lol jk I tasted them, they were the better of all 3 kinds we  ordered. 

So the verdict, don't come here if you're starving or sober. Probably best when you're drunk trying to sober up and probably don't care for good food.  This is FAR from authentic. NEVER AGAIN.
author: Jay N.

description: I've tried all the pupuserias, and I think this is the best.  Faves: pupusas con loroco, plátanos, empanadas de leche y horchata (Salvadorian style!).  Also have mexican food, but why would you!?
author: Kevin H.

description:
It's very unfortunate that I have to leave a 1 star review, but I had the worst experience yesterday.

I've been coming to this place for quite some time now for their delicious pupusas. I literally work across the street from this spot and I come in at least once a week. 

Yesterday, I called in an order for 2 pupusas (my girlfriend and I had dinner plans, so this was just a snack to hold us over). I head over with my girlfriend and realize I only had my credit card, so the girl (her name was Karin or something) tells me that they have a $10 minimum and that I need to get cash or order more. I tell her "sure, I'll just run up the street to the Bank of America." I tell her I'll be right back and ask if my girlfriend can start eating, and they say okay. 

I run up the street, grab cash, and run back to pay them. After paying for my meal, I ask for an extra fork so I can sit down with my girlfriend and eat. The girl sort of glares over at my girlfriend, then says that there is a minimum order of 2 pupusas per person to eat there. At this point, I start getting frustrated since I just ran up to get cash, but had I known there was a minimum order requirement (which would have brought us over the $10 minimum to use my card), I would have just swiped my card to begin with. 

The restaurant was completely empty, so I asked her if we could just eat our food and be on our way, and she said no. She said we needed to purchase 2 more pupusas to eat there. At this point, I was pretty damn pissed off and I grabbed our food and walked out. I asked her if this is how they treat returning customers, and she ignored me and walked off. 

It blew my mind that she treated us this way, especially knowing that I work right across the street. 

Oh well, I guess it's back to Taqueria Cancun...
author: Gerson K.

description: My family and I tried this place today, my wife had 3 popusas and an atol, I had the Super chicken Burrito and my son a plane cheese qusadila. First I do not recommend sitting towards the back of the restaurant because you can smell all the bad smells of the bathroom, then when our food was brought out to us they did not bring the sauce that goes with the popusas the waitress stood there and lectured us that there is no special sauce just to ask for the sauce that's for Chile rellenos. If they really knew Latin food we wouldn't have to ask for the sauce! Popusa come with cortido and red sauce. The atol De ellote was bad it was made with corn starch which is wrong, but on the bright side my burrito was very good and our son enjoyed his qusadilla. The food was out from time of order with in 10 minutes. 2 Stars for them out of 5 for the bathroom issue.
author: Joe L.

description: My husband and I ate at Los Panchos this past weekend and now I remember why we stopped going there. Upon arriving there we noticed the hostess station was now outside in the cold and no one was there to greet us. As we stepped inside to get out of the cold we were asked to go back out and wait for the hostess to put our name down, we were not off to a good start :/ Once seated we waited a good 15 minutes to even be acknowledged and then told that they were out of carnitas, refried and pinto beans!!!  Really, a Saturday night and they are out of the essentials at 7:00pm! Everytime we go there we are told they are out of carnitas, you would think if this was such a popular item they would increase their supply. Worst part of all was that our drinks came out about a minute before our dinner and we had yet to see our appetizer. I went to the salsa bar to get some additional sauces and the majority of their bowls were empty!  Advice to Los Panchos, even if you are busy, at least greet your customer and bring them their drinks, and keep your restaurant stocked with enough supply to feed your customers. If I could, I would not have even given them a one star rating, it would be no star at all!  Overall- poor service, wait staff with and attitudes and terrible greasy food with no flavor.
author: C J.

description:
I can't get enough of Los Panchos! My wife and I are connoisseurs of Salvadoran food, and we agree, Los Panchos has the best Pupusa's we've had in San Francisco! Not to mention, they're incredibly cheap! I think 2 pupusas here is even cheaper than a super burrito at most Mexican taquerias. 
Also one of my favorite meals from here, is the Chile Verde, so good it melts in your mouth. 

I also love the atmosphere, and the bright colors painted inside and out.  Complete with an oldschool Pacman table game, the inside is great for all ages.  The service has always been extremely friendly and helpful every time I go in. And, did you know they stay open until like 3 in the morning?! I can't be happier with my experience with Los Panchos! Bravo!
author: Jevir G.

description: Food is acceptable for Salvadorean oupusas but sadly that is overshadowed by the horrible customer service. The older man that was our server barely spoke to us and when he did it was a mumble followed with a bothered look. We asked for more chips (we had one small bowl for 4 of us). Aside from him acting like every request hurt every part of his being the end is what I am most upset about. There is a sign that says "bills will not be split in tables over 5 people", cool, we are FOUR. As we put our FOUR cards down be points at the sign and walks away. He comes back and I tell not sure what you said but we are 4 so that doesn't apply to our group. He said sorry nothing I can do about it. I asked again why if we were four and he pointed at the sign and just stood there. Rude rude rude....my friends and I will not be going here again. There are one too many good Salvadorean food places in SF to have to go here and deal with that type of attitude
author: J Flo Y.

description:
After a night of Skylarkin' it with Nahwal one Wednesday we decided to treat ourselves with some good late night eatery!  We first headed over to El Farolito but the line was 25 people deep and I really didn't feel like waiting.  I decided to have us drive through Mission Street, because I knew something else had to be open past 2am... LOW AND BEHOLD! Los Panchos still had patrons in it and I would rather eat Papusas over Jack in the Box!  

At $2.00 a peace we ordered 2 cheese and chickens and 2 pork and chicken papusas.  I used to love El Zocalo, but the quality has changed over the years... until now, I have not found my new go-to Papusa spot!  The papusas are made fresh and served to you piping hot!  Los Panchos DOES NOT skimp on the filling at all!  These papusas are large compared to others I've tried in the Mission too!

The only thing I did not like so much was the cabbage. I found that it was saltier rather than the "vinegary-pickled" flavor that I crave.. I have had better pickled cabbage. 

5 customers that night ordered some sort of Camarones platter - and let me tell you how HUGE they were! They don't skimp whatsoever!  That will definitely be the next dish that I try!

Customer service was also really good. They were pretty busy, and with one woman cooking and one server, service was very efficient.  The restaurant is also clean/well kept and nicely decorated.

See photos!
author: Chrysantha C.

description: Solid place from some late night pupusas. Salsa was delicious and the staff was very friendly.
author: Nik G.

description: This place is fantastic.  It's now an anomaly for good pupusas and Mexican in the bernal heights area.  Great decor, ambience and service.  There is a real warmth and history to this place.  It's good if you're on a budget or wanna go big.  Burritos are great and really fresh.  Pupusas are solid.  I also noticed the cleanliness of this place which is great.  In addition, there burritos are fresh and not greasy.  That is a rarity as most burritos around are loaded with too much fillers and too greasy.  Check it out.
author: Zach H.

description: Stopped in for a quick bit before an evening concert at a bar across the street. Recommended by the barkeep, the food was good - less oily than most taquerias. The sopas de platis had a good amount of tripe and vegetables, and the pupusas were awesome - big, hot and tasty.
author: Art H.

description: We came for El Zocalo but it is out of business... So ate here and it was great simple papusas and plantains!
author: Billy G.

description:
Wonder time I had here with my Auntie and mother, They love it here as well. 
Thanks Los Panchos For our Mexican Hot chocolate and giving me tips how to perfect it in making it in my own home. Great Pupusas, YAY Representing half of my family for El Salvador!
author: Liz T.

description:
I just had lunch here  with my ex  who happens to live across the street.  It was really good!  I had steak and eggs ... the steak was smothered in a red sauce with lots of tomatos and peppers cooked in.. couple of eggs on top and some DEEEEE-LISH frijoles refritos on the side.  

Thumbs UP:  Those beans - damn im gonna go back for more of those babies.
Thumbs DOWN:  The lady in the kitchen kept looking at me as if I was the only white guy that ever went in there - creepy
author: Jeff C.

description: What can I say about this place. They serve great pupusas and tasty fried bananas. This place is pretty cheap to eat. Their salsa tastes delicious. Try it on your pupusas and your taste buds will go crazy. I love coming to eat here, this is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco.
author: Michael V.

description: I'm going to keep this review short and simple. Best pupusas I have ever had in a restaurant!
author: Nels R.

description: I have been here three times and that has been plenty to realize the issue I had is a recurring issue. The first time I was there I ordered pork pupusas that showed up with only cheese but no pork. I mentioned it to the server and they looked at it agreeing they did not put pork in my pupusa. They remade my pupusas and still no noticable pork in it. I figured maybe they were just having a bad day. The second visit the same thing happened but this time the server (the one Latino guy who works as the waiter aka the owner's son) gave me attitude because I sent it back. He rudely took time to tell me that I did this the last time I was there. I had no idea he was keeping track of my visits. I am sorry that I am expecting pork in my pork pupusas that I am paying for! The third time I ordered a burrito. I figured I had a bad experience twice with pupusas so I'd order a burrito. I mean how can you make a bad burrito? Well came to discover it is possible at Los Pancho's. The minute I bit into my burrito I noticed there was no chicken in any of the bites I had taken despite ordering a chicken burrito and two bites into it my burrito, it fell apart. I was not drunk so I truly was not interested in getting messy with this tortilla that lay flat on my plate with a mess of beans and rice on it. I don't have high standards but I do expect that you put some care into the food especially if I am paying 9 dollars for a burrito. The gentlemen who is the server and owner's son was rude and continuously made remarks about me to the people I was with because I complained about the burrito. It is unfortunate that this individual has a nasty attitude because they are not caring for the food they are serving. Bad customer service and awfully made food. It is a local Latino business so I truly wanted to believe I could get past my bad experience and give it my business, but the awful treatment of customers who are not regulars and crappy food makes me want to give this place zero stars if  could. Not to mention the weird dynamic that plays out in front of customers where this server talks down to some of the other waitresses. I do not recommend this place. La zantaneca for pupusas is a way better option!
author: Katrina S.

description:
My friends and I went there tonight for little going away party, and this place was good for it. 

Service was friendly and somewhat fast, however on Tuesday night it was only couple of tables.

I tried pupusas -- cheese/beans, and cheese/pork combination. I liked the bean one more. 

Some of us had beer and with 20% tip bill came up to $13 per person.

Tip: 1.5 papusa per person is enough.
author: Anelya S.

description: Love this place. Pupusas and caldo de red y caldo de camarones is the best. But please owner tell you waiter not to wear so much cologne. It's bad when you walk away and your smell stays at the table for several minutes after.
author: Monica A.

description:
Just thinking about last night is making me hungry again, the pupusas were sooo good! Came here with Anelya S. and few other people, got the tables in the back (perfect for 8 of us and also not cold and windy from the door!) and ordered lots of pupusas, beer, and some plantains. I've never had either of the foods before. The plantains were o-k but I think it's my personal preference of not digging deep-fried banana-cousins. Pupusas were great, with pickled cabbage and guacamole. 

The place is a little out there, I'd definitely stop by again if in the area. Yum!

P.S. It's down the street from El Rio and open until 3am every day, a perfect place to pick up a little midnight snack!
author: Tatyana K.

description: I used to always have to decide between this place and El Zocalo (few doors down).  Two solid spots.  Since El Zocalo is closed, now I just go here.  Pupusas along with everything are hella good l...
author: Click C.

description:
Open late.
Authentic flavor and decor.
Friendly staff.
Cheap prices.
Yummy sangria!
author: Alice W.

description: Freakin love this place. I've been going here since I was a kid in the 80's and the food is still awesome. Best pupusas I've ever been able to find. Every time we are in the city we make it a point to get pupusas to take home.
author: Eric M.

description:
Of course it took $2 papusas to bring me out of Yelp hibernation.  Los Panchos, you are a delicious delicious conundrum.  On the one hand, you serve $2 food (granted, there is a rule that you have to buy 2 papusas so $4 I guess) and on the other, you have oddly ostentatious table service.  I mean, the guy guided us to our table, made small talk, took our order, delivered our food all with a smile.  Really, for $4, I woulda expected you to hand me my papusas in a brown paper bag and show me the door.  
I vote for getting a bunch of the pollo n' queso papusas.  I kinda regret ordering a variety because the pollo is just SO much better than the rest.  I also kinda regret eating the chips n' salsa after reading that the chips are fried in lard.  But man, those were some good chips n' salsa.
author: Azmina A.

description:
YUM YUM!!!!
This place was great! A friend took me and the pupusas are wonderful!! (had the chicken and cheese one) If you go order the SANGRIA it is amazing!!!!!!! I am from Spain so I know my SANGRIA and this one was one of the best that I have had in the states!!! YUM YUM Thumbs up for whoever makes the SANGRIA at this place!!!
author: Mia B.

description:
I've been coming here for over seven years, and this place has been consistently excellent.  

A coworker brought me here for lunch not long after I moved here from Boston, and hot damn if it didn't knock my socks off.  The pupusas are obviously the star of the show, and they're the best I've ever had.  They've recently expanded their horizons and began offering more varieties of pupusas, but I still stick with the pork and cheese.  I usually get the number four combo, carne asada with rice, salad, and plantains.  The wife usually gets enchiladas or menudo.  

Everyone I've ever brought here has fallen in love with the place instantly.  I have friends from out of town who dream about Los Panchos and beg me to take them there when they visit.  I'd probably do the same if I were forced to live apart from my dear, dear pupuseria.

Oh, and did I mention the sangria?  I could drink a jug of this stuff everyday, though that would probably destroy most of my personal relationships.  I can't think of a place with better sangria in the city.

On top of all of this, the folks who run the place are super awesome.  The kitchen, the waitstaff, everyone has always been amazing friendly and inviting.

So unless you hate delicious food and warm, inviting people, I suggest checking this place out!
author: joe p.

description:
Been coming here for ages. The pupusas here are the best in the city! This is one of my spots to go to whenever i'm around the area. The staff are very nice and friendly. Everytime i bring a friend here to try the pupusas they can't get enough.

This is the place to go and try great tasting pupusas.
author: Nelson M.

description:
Horrible... very disappointed with this place. 

Ordered the pupusas as well as some "Worst Nacho's I have evvvvverr" had... and I have had many... traveled to Mexico ...a myriad of times. 

I would for sure stay clear of this place...  especially since I see so many good reviews for it... but they must have been "planted / fixed"..that is all I can say.... 

.....would not go there again.. that is for sure.. 

...sorry...but telling you the truth. 

Cheers.
author: Alf M.

description:
Platanos maduros past 3am. 
Friendly service.
Spicy salsa.
This is the spot!!!
author: Charles F.

description: Decent pupusas (one was a little undercooked and doughy in the middle), BUT some of the best salsa, lard-cooked chips, and beef soup I've had in a while. Perhaps the pupusas were just on an off day -- I'll come back, and even if they're still not perfect, everything else is pretty good. :)
author: Josh K.

description:
Absolutely the WORST service in the world! 

After being reprimanded for the way we ordered our Pupusas, we waited 30 minutes for the thickest, greasiest and most blandest pupusas I've ever had. When we asked the waiter if we could have some chips, he said "we don't have any more, what do you want me to do!?" 

He let us know he was the owner and if we didn't like it, we could leave. 

What a disgrace to small business owners everywhere. 

Restaurante Familiar still reigns as the best pupusas in SF!
author: Cynsf Z.

description:
Great friggin Burrito!

If in your mind you have the vision and taste of the most perfectly wrapped burrito goodness, here is where you can turn that dream into reality. When i walked into Los Panchos at 11am on a Sunday morning i had high aspirations for the most tasty and sumptuous chorizo meated burrito with the best Mexican rice (sauteed w peas and carrots) accompanied with a bountiful amount of melted cheese (the most you could fit inside a burrito in fact).

I was very happy and had a food coma after. Thanks Los Panchos

PS. The Horchata is decent too!
author: Juan F.

description: One of my favorite places to grab a bite in La Lingua. The pupusas aren't too greasy and the rice is great. Admittedly, I haven't shopped around that many other pupusarias, since I found this place and pretty much settled on it. I recommend sticking to the pupusas but I don't think you'll be too disappointed if you venture off.
author: Baron C.

description: I've been here quite a few times and I've never been disappointed. Their pupusas are delicious and flavorful. I also highly recommend their sopa de res. The meat and vegetables are tender and the broth is light, but still savory. They have a combo where you can get 2 pupusas and a half bowl of sopa de res for about $10 (or maybe even slightly less, I don't remember).
author: Elena L.
Melanie F.

description:
Simply the best taqueria in the outer Mission. Great food and very affordable. Panchos is really just a casual Mexican restaurant. The decor is non existent, overly bright and not the most comfortable of places for a languid meal. They make their guacamole fresh and only right when you order it. 

What I really love is that it is basically all women that run it. They don't have the standard unpleasant hombre working the grill and line. The matron of the establishment is one of the nicest ladies to ever work in a restaurant. Panchos stands out among the countless scores of taquerias that litter SF.
author: Christopher N.

description: I have been going to this place for years! I would say that this is hands down the best Pupuseria in Frisko! They stay open late, for those who get the munchies after the club scene and always have been very courteous. I love their pupusas de harina de arroz!
author: Julio A.

description:
This is a nice little place -- though not quite as good as El Zocalo.

THE GOOD:

Pupusas -- nice texture and flavor, these are pupusas that you eat up (rather then get halfway through and say: what have I done?  I'm eating corn and cheese goo!)

Empanadas -- Mmmm, this is how they should be.  Fried with ground beef inside -- a guilty pleasure.

THE BAD:

Platanos Fritos -- dry and soulless, when they should be brown and gooey.

Yuca Frita -- not really bad, just boring.

Tamales -- yawn-inducing as well.

THE UGLY:

Horchata -- this was an incredibly sweet, cinnamony concoction that feels like it was created to kill diabetics with one sip.  On the other hand, certain people might like it.
author: Daniel S.

description:
GREAT pupusas! 

Mar y tierra is a dish with carne asada and shrimp, rice, beans and salad.  Delicious!  Their chile verde is super!  

They have tasty atol de elote and hot chocolate. 

We are regulars at Panchos and will be for years to come!
author: Carina M.

description:
when my normal saturday night 3am burrito need kicks in, i'll eat anywhere, even taco bell.. so when i actually find a REALLY good burrito at that hour i *somewhat* remember it. it was delicious and filling, and it's almost an after-party of wherever you were coming from. everyone is drunk and happy and basking in the glory of munchies.
i must have liked them a lot, because it was apparent from what was in my purse that i took all of their cards from the counter. sorry los panchos. i'll be back though.
author: Liz M.

description: Yessir.  I've been to El Salvador and eaten real deal street papusas and these are as close as I've tasted to that in the US.  VERY good, do not miss it!  I keep it simple and get dos papusas con frijole y queso....y platanos con crema tambien ;)
author: chadmalik ..

description: I've said it before and I will say it again, this is the best carne asada I have ever had in my life. The steak is perfectly marinated and seasoned. When I'm craving asada, only Los Panchos will satisfy my craving, . That being said, all the other items I've had from Los Panchos were delicious as well. I personally, would stick to the Salvadorean food as Mexican is not their specialty. Their soups are great, pupusas are good and the yucca is fried perfectly crisp. The curtido (Salvadorean pickled cabbage) and salsa that go w/ the pupsusa and yucca are great as well. No complaints from me, even the service is good. My family and I have been loyal patrons for 25+ years.
author: Blessed K.

description:
I have been to several restaurants in the Mission that serves Sarlvadorean food, but never been to this one. TB said he was hungry so he took me here.

As always I let him order since he knows what I like too anyway. We had the shrimp, revuelta pupusas and platnanos con crema...yummm.

Sometimes I base how good the restaurant is from the number of people inside. Since we were just the 2nd table, I had my doubts but then I was mistaken not only was service good but the food as well.

If you want some pupusas fix, this is another place in the MIssion that certainly needs to be tried.
author: Malou C.

description: I'm their poster gal for the chicken enchilada suiza. It's what I usually order, it's my fave! Steaks really good too. And for dessert, fried platanos
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description: Somethings changed about this place? New paint on the walls? More friendlier service?  More delicious pupusas? What ever it be, I'm upping the place to 5 stars.
author: B H.

description:
Best Salvadorian Food/Pupusas!

I looked this place up at work today and I thought it was worth a shot. I really have been craving Mexican food but this Salvadorian food sounded good and had the parts of the Latin American cuisine that I really wanted anyway.

When I walked in I wasn't sure where to order from (the window just left of the doorway to the kitchen) and I felt a little awkward. I was afraid the guy was going to be rude but he was actually really nice and totally fine with me taking the food to go.

I ordered the typical platter and the enchilada (about 20 bucks after tax). They were both amazing! I thoroughly enjoyed each part of each of them. The pupusas were as amazing as everyone says. What I did not expect was how good everything else was. I was expecting was pupusas that lived up to the hype. What I got was two dishes with sides that were nothing short of brilliant. The papas fritas that came with the typical platter were a preparation of potato out of a dream (so crunchy on the the outside and soft on the inside). The tamale had so much flavor I didn't know what to do with it (other than eat it lol). Their was something else that came with the typical platter that was fried beautifully and meaty on the inside like a small pupusa. I don't remember what it was called but it also rocked my world. The enchilada was juicy, flavorful and the beans, rice, and salsa that went with it complimented it perfectly.
author: Stephen S.

description: I have been going to this place for years and I am disappointed that I haven't written a review yet. It has been over 10 years that I have frequented this restaurant and within that time frame, the quality of the food and service has never faulted. It's nice to keep on going to a restaurant where me ans my family are recognized as frequnt visitors. The papusas are absolutely the best in town. I always get papusas and empanada del leche. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. If you are looking for great quality food and awesome service,  this is the place to go :).
author: Vanessa M.

description: Wonderful papusas, fried plantains with beans and crema; very reasonably priced. Everything fresh and delicious. Topped off by great service. What more can you ask for?
author: Dennis B.

description: The chile Colorado was grrrrreat!  Just found my favorite San Francisco Mexican restaurant.  I'll have to try the pupusas next.  =)
author: Kyle G.

description: Chimichangas. Unreal. Wish I lived closer to this unheralded gem.
author: Ruari H.

description:
Been here twice now.
Have had their Chicken Tamal meal and I LOVE it! Very authentic and delicious. Shared a plate of Yuca with my friend and they were yummy with some salt and lemon. Great ambience. The people are always super friendly.
author: corri i.

description: I had a pupusa competition recently between Los Panchos, El Zocalo, and Nena's. Los Panchos overall was my favorite restaurant out of the three. There is a lot of dope Salvadoran art and even some dummies in the balconies. There is a broad above the front door that a lot of people don't notice. Our waitress was really nice and pleasant. I really enjoyed the salsa that came with the complementary chips and could have been happy just eating that. The pupusas like most other spots are $2 each and I appreciated that they weren't overcooked like some of the other places I've had them at. But what really put it over the top was combining them with the salsa. I'm looking forward to trying out the rest of the menu now that I know that this is the place for my pupusa fix.
author: Steve A.

description:
parking is semi available...just depends when you're there...but you should find some its not too difficult.

papusas.  thats why i came here.  its a nicely decorated lots of seating restaurant...but do we care how much room there is?  its about the papusas!

i went and its 2 dollars per papusa.  BUT you have to order 2 papusas at a time of whichever papusa your ordered, which is 2 papusas for 4 dollars.  Not a bad deal.  Its actually a great deal.

the papusas were fresh and tasty and if i knew how to make them like this, i'd be eating at home...but i'll have to come by here whenever i'm nearby.  This is definitely some of the best Salvedorean food in the city.
author: Bing D.

description: One of the best pupusa places in town!  I started coming here many years ago when a native Salvadoran friend told me this is the best place (what better referral than that?) to get pupusas.  I usually go with my staple, pork & cheese, but I'm sure the rest of the options and menu items are good.  The only things I don't like here is that it can be really crowded (good sign though) and the horchata is terrible.  Now that can be a personal thing as I think Mexican horchata tastes much better.  Anyway, you can't go wrong here with the pupusas!
author: Jeff M.

description:
Yum! 

Came here on a whim after helping A move. Late at night, nothing was open in my neighborhood (Noe Valley) or his (Bernal Heights). This place, however, is open til 3am weekdays and 4am on weekends.  Watch out, the complimentary salsa is quite spicy.  I got the pupusas, delicious. Huge size for only $2; maybe 6 inches in diameter. 

A got a carne asada burrito, $6. Looking at it, meh, seems full of rice. But it's great too. The meat's tasty and I'm pretty sure they shove an entire (or at least half) avocado in it. Impressive considering some places charge over $1 for a few slices. He also got the fried plantains; $6 and  it comes with beans & sour cream. He enjoyed the plantains.  Definitely coming back to eat everything else.
author: Yan E.

description: I absolutely love Los Panchos!! It's one of my favorite places to dine at. I've been coming here for a few years now, because the food is fresh and delicious without breaking the bank. Not to far from my house either. They've also done some renovations with the resturaunt. If you're in the area try it out.. Oh yea, another thing I love about Los Panchos is their friendly wait staff and how late they stay open. Good vibes, yummy food, 5 stars.
author: Lisa L.

description:
So, great pupusas. Not over greasy and good quality ingredients. $2.00ea. is cheap.
Poor service and frankly the place smells not of food but old and musty funk.
My wife ordered one cheese and one  bean and cheese. Receives one cheese and one cheese and pork. No biggie but when we told the waitress she just says OK. Does not offer to provide what my wife actually ordered. Sad.
When we first walked in the place has a real appetite killing odor. Know it is old but this is a huge negative.
author: Rodger L.

description: Great food - everything I have tried is awesome. Good salsas/sauce. Lovely, warm people run this place. It really feels like a family-run restaurants. Mariachi guys come in and play music. It has a great feel. I don't know what else to say - the place rocks! The only negative - when it gets crowded, it can be quite loud. The service is quite good.
author: Phil L.

description: Searching for a late night spot on Mission St would seem like a simple task.  Apparently not.  So, we were pleasantly surprised to find this spot just up the block from Roccupulco.  When my lovely partner ordered the plaintain I thought I would be disappointed.  Man, those things were kinda scrumptious, especially with the crema and refried beans for dipping.  But, the best part was the pupusas.  Man.  They spit. hot. fire. (been waiting for an opportunity to say something spits hot fire).  Simple, but tasty/flavorful.  So, why the three stars?  Not a whole lot of fully vegetarian options, the tamarind was good, but a little overpriced, and it took them a while to clear dirty tables (not pleasant to look at while eating).  However, this place is definitely on the three side of four rather than the four side of three.  3.5+
author: CS W.

description: Now this place. I was craving pupusas on a Friday night after the bar scene. When I came here, I was surprised on how many folks were here after 2am. I ordered my pupusas which tasted great. I love discussing the long late w/ your friends over a meal. Something like that speaks great in my life. Which makes me smile over my meal and with my friends. The waiter service was great. The food too was excellent.
author: Matt B.

description:
I was tired of waiting at El Zocalo so I walked on down the street to Los Panchos and it was love. This became my favorite place to get pupusas at the most random times. 

I always ordered the Pupusas de harina de arroz - revueltas. The rice flour gives the pupusas a different chewy texture that I loved and a slightly different flavor. 

The food is really inexpensive so take cash if you're only getting pupusas because they have a min. for cc transactions. BofA is just down the street.
author: Isabel M.

description: These are the best pupusas in the city and they're open till 3am! I absolutely love this place and will miss living so near it. Pupusas are only $2 (minimum of two per order) restaurant is kept very clean, great chips and salsa if you eat in, good service and outstanding El Salvadorean food.
author: Joseph N.

description: Other yelpers have made it pretty clear that the pupusas are all that and a bowl of crispy homemade chips. Truth.  These crisp-on-the-outside, gooey-on-the-inside wonders are just what the hangover doctor ordered!  On top of that, though, I give high marks for the ridiculously friendly service, amazing salsa, and a pretty respectable plate of enchiladas suizas in tangy green sauce.  All good here, my friends!
author: Julie L.

description: Open late. Delicious pupusas. What more can a gal ask for? I find that the pupusas are pretty hearty, so one is plenty for me. Two is great if I'm feeling super hungry. I also love the atol de elote. So yummy! It feels like a warm hug:)
author: Joanne R.

description: Service sucks at this time waitress not attentive and they don't care if you are there
author: Mike S.

description: Two pupusas for $2!! Who can beat that???  Ate an early dinner here with two my sisters and my nephew about a month ago. I split the pollo and chorizo with one my sisters and ate some of my other sister's fried platanos. YUM, YUM, YUM!!! Glad this place didn't burn down from that fire a month and a half ago. The aroma of smoke still lingered in the restaurant though. Mmmm...now I'm craving pupusas =).
author: Neni E.

description:
This is a nice spot, one of the best pupusa places in the Mission I'd say.  All the benefits of pupusa spots: tasty, fried and affordable.  I'm partial to the pupusas with the capers in 'em, but everything else is good to.

Los Pancho's also has an nice diorama of a sleeping cowboy/mariachi above the dining area, and that's a good touch.

They folks who run the restaurant are pretty nice, pupusas take a while to make, but in the meantime the salsa and chips keep coming and they don't blink when you order the third round of beer.  

I think long ago they used to have Ace of Spades, my favorite Salvadorian Pilsner, but not recently.  That's okay though, despite the clean taste and awesome name, Ace tends to have a broccoli finish that can be off-putting.
author: Gustie L.

description:
Best. Horchata. EVAR.

And the pupusas, the tamals, the salsa, the pllllaaaannnnntaaaaaaiiiinnnnnns.....  The empanadas de leche.....  So much delectable fried goodness, I can actually feel my salivary glands manufacturing and transporting mass quantities of product.

Oh man, and they're open late enough for you people who like to come to my neighborhood and get so drunk that you start fights in the street....  to eat something and calm the fuck down!!

Buen provecho!
author: Melanee N.

description: These guys lost a customer today- I order Los panchos on Gopago.Paid. Get a message stating food will be ready in 10 minutes. Arrive at restaurant 15 later,and I quoth "yeah we're not gonna honor it because the  machine did not print out a machine and without it we dont get paid." Left hungry. No call. No Apology.
author: Cody W.

description:
Los Panchos is a dud. Anyone who likes their Pupusas should really take a stroll up Mission and check out La Santaneca which gets a 4.5 out of 5 for theirs. Sadly Los Panchos rates maybe a 2 for their Pupusas, greasy, doughy and slightly burned, even the Curtido (pickled cabbage) was bland:( The pupusa selection was also pretty minimal, which means really it isnt a real pupuseria.
The service was pretty bad as well. 
We were there pretty late so maybe I could cut them some slack for that..but I wont.
author: Catty C.

description:
Yes, i was addicted to their Beef Soup for a week in the winter.

For $6, you can't beat the warm stewed beef and fresh veg with tortillas.

and they are open till 3am every damn day!

wicked
author: Tak H.

description:
Fan-fock'n-tastic pupusas! This is my new favorite place for pupusas. The GF and I were on a hunt to try some new Mexican\Latin American food. We had the urge for tacos, but wanted to try something down at the Mission\Bernal Heights junction. 

We'd spotted a bunch of Mexican and Salvadorean restaurants on our last visit to the area(Jasmin Tea House) and vowed to come back to systematically check'em out. Well, Los Panchos was a  memorable first restaurant down in the Mission\Bernal corner! 

To start we ordered pupusas. I got revueltas(cheese and pork) and she got cheese. The cabbage that came with them was tasty but not as spicy as I would have liked.

For main entree: she order sopa de camaron(shrimp soup) and I went the bistec salvadoreno. Yum, yum, double and triple yum! The soup was really unique and tasty. It almost looked like egg flower soup. The steak was cooked to perfection, so tender and juicy, in a redtomatoe sauce with bell peppers and onions. The beans and rice were equally well done. We washed the meal down with a couple Negra Modelos and we were happy campers. 

Will definitely be back for more pupusas and to try more entrees.

Our server was great as was the cook. The whole show was run by just two women. Rock on ladies!
author: isaias J.

description:
The best Salvadoran restaurant in the Mission. Not much for atmosphere, but it's open late.

First, it is famous for its "Carne Asada Los Panchos", which is a flank steak dinner with french fries and a salad for only $7.50.

Second, the papusas are the best in the Mission. The papusas are better than La Santaneca because they are served so hot that you can't even eat them, and the coleslaw that goes on top is better. The salsa here is actually a little too spicy for papusas, although it goes good with chips and other items.

Finally, there are all sorts of awesome Salvadoran delicacies on the menu that my friends were ordering, but I can't remember their names. This menu definitely rewards the adventurous!
author: Adam Z.

description:
This place is great. Open late, the price is right, and the food is delicious... Also, I gotta say, I don't know what's up with the salsa here but I can't seem to get enough of it. The service is friendly and the atmosphere is nice (If a bit loud at times). 

Suggestion: The Typical Platter. Absolutely delicious, with a great mix of Salvadorean food. Throw in the free chips and salsa and you're set (And depending on how much you eat, you could be set for two meals).
author: D. W.

description:
Pupusas and I have a love/hate relationship.  I get cravings for them and they taste sooooooo good, but about 15 minutes after I eat them, it feels like all their cheesy, greasy goodness has lodged itself right about in my pulmonary artery.  

But somehow (magically??), Los Panchos is able to create non-greasy pupusas.  How they can make a big slab of fried cheese not turn out insanely greasy, I do not know, but I'll take it, be thankful, and come back for more.
author: Megan D.

description:
I'm telling you- the carne asada los panchos is still the best thing on the menu!!!

The pupusas are also good! I love Los Panchos because they are open late (til 2 or 3am). My friend and I were starving after our night class and headed to one of the few places that was nowhere near closing. We split the steak and got a pupusa each and left very satisfied. TRY THE STEAK, you can thank me later!
author: Valerie A.

description:
Have had a great time here. The first time I showed up in the afternoon to pick up some papusas for dinner. The lady gave me chips, salsa and water to munch on while I waited, and asked me if I'd ever had papusas before (I hadn't). Took them home, they were delicious (and not too pricey either).

The next time was about a month later. I got the same waitress again, and she actually recognized me. "You came back!" 

Very nice people, very good food, and open pretty goddam late.
author: Keane N.

description: My mouth is watering just thinking about the "Carne Asada Los Panchos"....the carne asada is tender and juicy...and the marinade is something special...it's a simple meal that comes with a salad(basically lettuce) and fries...but it all goes well together...the service is great...I've have been coming here since I was a little kid...love this place! Pupusas are really good too...this place is open really late so after a night out in the City they'll still be open...
author: Mr E.

description: The food here was OK. I came here on Friday at about 2am-ish after leaving the bars. hmmmm I ordered 2 pupusas 1 queso and 1 queso y loroco. Also UN Plato DE platanos y frijoles con crema.It was honestly just ok. I couldn't even see or taste the loroco. The cheese was good. Frijoles were just alright. prob the only time I come here. I will head over to 18th for my favorite Balompie
author: Mary Jane P.

description: When ever we go to the clubs, we come here after since its open until like 3:30 AM or some craziness.. great way to end a night of giggin....they are chill about moving tables to seat ten folks.... nothing says loving like their empanadas and pupusas with some frijoles and arroz.... their pupusas de revuelta---- off the chain. The platenos are a must.....While my friends are sobering up on some food, and drinking their salvi horchata like no other, I get to enjoy some food that is not available to me in Santa Cruz. Even if it was available in Santa Cruz... It wouldn't be as good.
author: Vicky T.

description: Great authentic Mexican food! I didn't get a burrito but I will next time. The entrée I got was delicious though. Efficient service too.
author: Robert M.

description: best place hands down to go to if youre looking for a good meal and not jack n the box or mcdonalds after a long night of clubbing or bar hopping; open really late and very affordable! delicious :)
author: Yamilette C.

description: I had a popusa, fried chicken and my date had the chicken flautas. Food was okay but the chan drink was AWESOME. Pretty good spot for dinner.
author: Genaro R.

description: Los Panchos is one of my favorites!  The pupusas are cheesy and delicious and the carne asada is to die for!
author: Evan O.

description: Loved the pupusas, carne asada and platanos!  The service was also excellent!
author: Grace C.

description:
came here dreaming of pupusas before el rio and was disappointed - the revueltas were mushy without being gooey and the ensalada was coleslaw mix in vinegar - no oregano or other excitement. the platanos were dry with bland beans - other salvordeno places give you the yummy bacony beans, but these were straight out of the can. very disappointing.
the space and service and location were ok, but i would send you to la santaneca for pupusas and to los jarritos for huevos rancheros.
author: Casey W.

description: I ordered 2 Pupusas to-go. The cashier kept saying they are almost ready. After 25 min of waiting, I finally fed up and left the restaurant without getting any Pupusas. Extremely slow service.
author: Fatih K.

description: My 3 year old said he wanted mexican food today, lol.  So we went to Mission St to look for somewhere good.  This place looked nice and clean and was not crowded, set in restraunt style, not taquaria style.  The food is priced very fair and reasonable.  The food was delish!!! down to the tortillas...  My Chile Relleno reminded me of my grandmothers cooking.  The pupusas were also great, my 3 year old and 1 year old ate everything... The  cook also  very friendly.  Unfortunately I could not give the place 5 stars because a lady that was also there working i think, asked my age, 31, and commented a few times on how hard my life must be with 2 small children....  I kinda just told her like my life is pretty great, obviously not struggling because Im taking my kids to eat and ordering food just for them to eat!?!?!  But besides that I will be back
author: DEANNA W.

description:
I was craving pupusas on Friday.  For some reason, I wanted to go somewhere that had some slammin' pupusas and our friend, Mark, suggested Los Panchos.  They ordered surf and turf, but I ordered pupusas--three of them (with cheese, with bean/cheese, and pork and cheese). Each was slammin' and they gave plenty of pickled cabbage.  Salsa could have used a little more flavor, but it was alright.  And at $2/each, it was a bargan!  Service was also pretty attentive, which is great.  I'll definitely be back.

P.S.  My husband and our friend, Mark, loved the carne asada and highly recommend it.  I had a bite and it was pretty slammin'.
author: Quyen T.

description: The pupusas here are good. The staff was friendly. The salsa and chips are delicious; there is a complexity to the salsa that is really nice and the chips are thin and crispy like I like them. The real bonus here though is that it is open past 2AM every night of the week. So why 3 stars? Because its just a solid good. Nothing pushed me into the excellent range. But I'll definitely be back.
author: Mathew d.

description:
Their food to me was A-OK.  It's really convenient though since I go to Knockout a lot, and they are open late.  Pupusa was good, but their deep fried plantain was way too oily, and so as other pork pot sticker looking thing.

Ordered a glass of sangria and tasted like a strawberry juice.  Is it how it supposed to taste like?
author: Yoko S.

description: This is the only place where I get my pupusas after a long day in San Francisco. I have literally driven from San Jose to SF just to get a taste of these delicious pupusas. Their inexpensive and the flavor/taste makes it worth every penny. I always come out of this place happy and pleased. The ambience is very peaceful and trust me, they make you feel like your at home. Highly recommend!
author: Melissa G.

description:
The papusas were excellent.  I did the cheese and pork combo.  I love their guacamole too--best anywhere.

I love the fact that the staff puts up with my pathetic attempts to speak Spanish.  All I really know is "hola" and "gracias".  I took French in school.
author: Kandi K.

description:
I think this is now one of my favorite places to eat. The papusas are soooo good!!  I have tried many-a-papusa that was full of oil... but Los Panchos? Nope, they're just right.  
The salsa is pretty good too and friendly service is always nice!  This place is definitely a great choice for a late night papusa  after some drinks!
I'm getting hungry now....
author: Jackie O.

description:
Best Papusas around the 'hood.  Not too greasy, not too dry.  The atmosphere is fitting with the Folkloricos and the Pit-pattering of papusas being made from scratch in the background.

Best thing on the menu is the Dry Garlic rubbed shrimp from the menu on the back.

Awesome place!
author: Michael C.

description: Whenever I feel like I haven't met my weekly quota of lard, I head on over to Los Panchos.  In all seriousness, the food is delicious.   I only ever order the pupusas and platanos - piled high with the cabbage stuff.  It's the perfect harmony of Salvadorean food.  I typically require a nap after eating at Los Panchos, that's why I will only go on weekends or at night.
author: Mama M.

description: I love this place, this is the frist Pupuseria I came to eat Pupusas with my girl, she brought me here and I loved the Pupusas!! They have a very very great taste like no other places!! I for sure RECOMEND this place if you like to eat some Pupusas!!!
author: Nena L.

description:
Very Good Chiles Rellenos, went here with my good friend Jackie and her boyfriend Felipe to this place after going dancing during the summer.

Have yet to try the rest of their Menu.

Pretty Good!
author: Alberto L.

description:
OK pupusas.  Gotta have the steak & fries, though!  
25 years of eating here have built the waistline up.  One of these days they'll hafta stuff me and put me in one of the overhead alcoves...
author: Jombo J.

description: I love this place!  We go there at least once a month for papusas.  It's inexpensive and the food is good.  Sometimes we eat there but we usually get take-out.  Our order is always correct and ready in about 15 minutes which is great because we can order, drive down to pick up and it's ready when we get there.  If you haven't tried this place you should give it a try.  The ambience is lacking if you'r looking for romance but if you're just out for a good meal this is your place!
author: Connie L.

description: I went to this place for dinner for the first time upon hearing some reviews about their pupusas. I've personally seen better.  Usually, they provide a cabbage type salad on top of the pupusas or on the side. This one had some kind of salad on the side. The food was ok.  I wasn't impressed by the service at all. There was ONE waitress and half a dozen people behind the counter cooking, working on the register and doing other things. I think they need to hire someone else. This woman was running all over the place trying to serve half a dozen tables full of families.   If you're really hungry and in a hurry, I wouldn't recommend this place.  But, if you don't care about the long wait in service and you're craving any kind of pupusas, then this is for you.    I had their quesadillas and I thought that was ok too.
author: O ..

description: I love pupusas.  And I love breakfast.   But more importantly, I love pupusas and breakfast late at night.  Los Panchos definitely fulfills all those needs.  I was fully expecting to love this place purely for their pupusas (which were really, really good), but it turns out that they have breakfast items on the menu, as well.  Huevos rancheros happens to be my all-time personal breakfast fave, and I will proclaim undying love and loyalty to any place willing to cook me up some huevos rancheros any time I want them.  Good food, great restaurant...will definitely be going back soon.
author: Becca V.

description: I am currently obsessed with pupusas.  I want to eat at every pupusaria in Bernal Heights.  I am on a mission.  These were great and I love that you can eat two pupusas for $2 and be full.  Of course, I always have to add on the expensive plantains, beans and sour cream combo which raises the cost.  Unfortunately, these plantains were not as crisp as I like and were a little greasy and soggy.  Overall though, it was a good experience and I love that they are open late.
author: Stacy R.

description: I just had the flautas plate here and loved it. Their service also seems to be more responsive than El Zocalo a few doors down.
author: Bill K.

description: Late night good eatin' with tasty savory pancakes, yum! My only advice, eat half, take the rest to go for lunch the next day. I'm not an expert, but everything tasted pretty damn good to me and I loved the spicy cabbage on the side. Oh and the lady who served us was nice.
author: e g.

description: Now serving chicken and zuchini papusa mmmmmmm good!  Great service too!   Open late, real late ; )  This is definitely a sure shot.  This IS my favorite papusa spot, glad they stepped it up!  And the Beans, just perfect!
author: sonia m.

description: Such comforting, fresh, authentic food, HUGE portions, open all hours, friendly family run service. Perfect to sop up the booze after the Knockout or Rio, or just to enjoy a lazy afternoon lunch or dinner. Their pupusas are to die for, made by hand,  with generous sides of pickled cabbage, sour cream, guac, and any other toppings you ask for. I prefer the bean and cheese or zucchini pupusas. The shrimp was a bit off for my taste, but it may have been my palate that particular day as I was fighting a cold. ;-) The salsa is absolutely addicting and if you order to go they give you a vat's worth in what looks like a 12 oz container! I wish I could go more often, the prices can't be beat (the last time we went we paid less than $14 for three pupusas and they gave us two heaping bags worth of sides/condiments/chips to go. My bf and I had a hard time finishing all of it since the portions were so big). The food is some of the best in the Bay. Family run, friendly faces, GREAT food!
author: Steenie K.

description: You're in San Francisco, it's late and you want some Salvadorean food to soften the little buzz you have on before driving back home to Pacifica.  My spot of choice is always Los Panchos.  First, get this, they're open until 4am.  Second the Sopa De Camarones (prawn soup) is the schizzle.  I can hardly type the words without getting hungry omg, it's that good.  K, maybe you don't like prawns, then have the Pupusas Con Arroz Y Frijoles or the Platanos Fritos Con Frijoles Y Crema, (you will thank me later).  Lastly, the ladies that work there are friendly and courteous.  It's a nice nieghborhood place with the San Francisco feel, you'll like it.  Outtee.
author: Frank C.

description: Don't bother with the classic Mexican dishes, rather go straight to the Salvadorean treats.  Pupusas?  Yup.  Hot n' greasy until 4:00 am.  Wolf down some free chips with your 32 oz. Regia (Reh-Hee-Uh) then douse your pupusa with tangy coleslaw and go to town.  Good service, fresh yummy food, and a colorful clientele, especially after 1:00 am on Friday and Saturday...  Even Dustin S. must throw in the towel at Los Panchos.
author: Eric S.

description: Damn delicious cheap pupusas revueltas. Haven't had the other items on the menu. Would give 4 stars but the pupusas can take a really long time to come out and even though the staff is nice they'll sometimes forget to put in your order and you have to remind them.
author: Aileen T.

description: I grew up chowing down on pupusas at El Zocalo just up the street from Los Panchos. A few weeks ago, my dad took me here instead. Hallelujah! I have seen the light. I have to admit that I have never ordered anything else here. And to be even more honest, I never will. Their pork and cheese pupusas are enough to make me come back over and over and over... I have dreams about this place.
author: Maya S.

description: Been here a couple of times. The food is very flavorful. I especially like the dishes made in Chille Verde(Green sauce). the portions you get are big and have that home cooked taste to them. It does get crowded in the later part of the evenings which means there is a long wait for you food. The service is friendly and overall the place is clean. The pricing i found to be higher than other Mexican/Salvadoranian places around this area for the same quality and amount of food but not by that much.
author: Alfredo N.

description: My family has been coming to this whole in the wall spot for years. We drive all the way from Milpitas for one thing...Chili Colorado (with flour tortillas please, come on I am white). The atmosphere is...uhm rustic and you really don't want to go to the bathroom but the food is delicious, cheap and consistent. Open very late is a plus!
author: Melissa L.

description: We went dancing at Roccapulco and asked for a recommendation on where to eat.  The bartender sent us to Los Panchos.  Luckily it was open pretty late.  I like the salsa.  It's a bit on the spicy side, but not burn your mouth spicy.  I had the chile verde, which was good.  My friend had the garlic shrimp, which he exclaimed to be the best shrimp ever (and he is one of those foodies that eats at all of the best restaurants).  The staff was super nice.  The ambience is not super fancy or romantic, but the food was great!
author: catrina l.

description: I really love the pupusas here and platanos fritos.  If you are looking for something sweet - the etole is excellent.  Old favorite.  If you are lucky, you can see the mariachi band with the stand up bass.
author: Dana C.

description:
my restaurant instinct failed me this time. i was sure that los panchos was going to be a favorite of mine, but boy was i wrong. after trying nena's, this place paled in comparison. their chicken soup just didn't measure up - the vegetables were paltry, miserable looking things. the horchata was much too sweet. the pupusas - they were soggy. SOGGY! and the curtido wasn't so good either.

sigh. too bad.
author: jennifer y.

description: This place is on my speed-dial, not just because of the close proximity to my house but because their pupusas are delicious - I give them a 9.  They are pretty close to perfect.  And I love that they are open late because pupusas taste oh so good after a night of drinking.  The rest of the food I hear is pretty good but I just come here for the pupusas and the occasional order of plantains or yuca.
author: P D.

description: The four star rating is for the delicious homemade papusas with perfectly melted queso.  Otherwise I'd give the restaurant a three.  I found the the salsa watery and lacking flavor (but not spice) and the chimichanga and tostada were good but not amazing.
author: erin h.

description: Maybe I've become too health conscious. But I left here feeling weighed down, sleepy, bloated, and icky.   The food tasted okay, the beans were excellent, the rice was delicious, but everything else fried in lard just added up to way too much greasy heaviness.
author: Laura A.

description: Um, i'm in heaven here. Most authentic mexican and salvadorian food in town. I feel so at home here, even though my spanish is horrible. Papusas are a must, all the soups i've had are great, and the plato tipico is a great way to go. I recomend it to all my friends.
author: Jeff L.

description: hands down the best cabbage in the city. also, cheap! when too tired to cook i can order a pupusa plate w/ 2 pupusas and rice and beans and salad and cabagge and there. split between 2 people, its less than 4 dollars each for a whole lot of food. thats awesome.
author: Lily S.

description: It's 2am... they have damn good pupusas... what else can you ask for?  Cheap, but expect a little bit of a wait for your cooked-to-order  eats.
author: Michael H.

description: This is a place that has both Salvadorean and Mexican food. If you are a fan of pupusas, you will love Los Panchos. I especially enjoy their revueltas (cheese and bean pupusas). Their salsa is a bit spicy, yet addicting, though I'm not one to enjoy hot food...I also recommend their horchata - you'll be hooked. I guarantee whatever you order will be satisfying and filling. It's a perfect location to get a late night meal in the city; closes at 3 a.m. If you're looking for a reasonable, good, authentic meal, try it, you'll be glad you did.
author: Yesenia S.

description: Now you look at this place and looks like a hole in the wall nobody in there must not be good so you walk over two business up and see El Zocalo jammed packed nowhere to sit so you think do i want to wait or just eat and make my stomach stop talking to me. This is how I started coming to Los Pancho and let me tell you much better than El Zocalo pupusas are not as greasy don't get me wrong i like a little grease but i don't like to cut into my pupusa and have a cup worth of oil rush out of it. And if you are not in the mood to have pupusas go for the carne asada and french fries plate for only 6.95 the plate Its the best dam piece of steak i had. oh and lets not forget while a lot of places are closed and El zocalo shut its doors at 3am Los Panchos remains open until 4am yes  people I said 4am need I say more
author: Nina A.

description: this is my favorite chicken soup in san francisco. i don't add the rice or eat the tortilla.
author: rachel l.

description: best pupusas this side of the border. most definitely the best Salvadorian food EVER!
author: Jessie M.
